0.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' a source of entertainment for people: BJP leader
0.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Friday criticised the Congress and said Rahul Gandhi's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a source of entertainment for people. He called the initiative a weak move and added that Congress is gradually losing its strength, no matter what they do. "Our government will be formed in...Gujarat and Himachal [Pradesh] following the upcoming Assembly elections," he added.

1.title: J&K LG meets relatives of Kashmiri Pandit killed by terrorists in Shopian
1.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Friday met the family members of Puran Krishan Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit who was shot dead by terrorists in Kashmir's Shopian on October 15. Sinha offered his condolences to Bhat's wife and his children. The LG has assured that the culprits will be brought to book, Bhat's relative AK Raina said.

2.title: Biden vows to 'free' Iran during campaign speech in California
2.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday vowed to "free" Iran and said, "They are gonna free themselves pretty soon," referring to Iranian anti-hijab protesters. Biden did not expand on his remarks. The statement came during a midterm election campaign speech in a community college in California as dozens of demonstrators gathered outside the venue expressing solidarity with the Iranian protesters.

3.title: Opium addict kills parents and 2 sons in Jodhpur, later dies by suicide
3.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly killed his parents and his two sons, aged 14 and eight, and later died by suicide in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, police said on Friday. According to Lohawat SHO Badri Prasad, the accused was an opium addict. Police suspect the man, who dumped his family members' bodies in a water tank at his house, had earlier drugged them.

4.title: Need more matches against top teams to bridge gap: Ireland skipper
4.article_body: After crashing out of the T20 World Cup on Friday, Ireland skipper Andrew Balbirnie said that they need more opportunities to play against top cricketing nations in order to bridge the gap between them. "We're by no means the finished article, but we certainly are a better team than we were 12 months ago," Balbirnie said.

5.title: Work underway at fast pace: Union Minister on new Parliament building
5.article_body: Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said the construction work of the new Parliament building is going on at a very fast pace. "We have...4,000 people working round-the-clock on it," Puri said. In August, Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore had told Lok Sabha that November is the deadline to complete the project.

6.title: Govt authorities thwart child marriage attempt in Indore
6.article_body: The anti-child marriage flying squad thwarted a child marriage attempt by a family in the Dhabli village of Madhya Pradesh's Indore district. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly getting married to a 21-year-old man before the authorities rushed to the spot and warned the girl's family about the consequences of child marriage, an official said.

7.title: I spent a few years contemplating suicide: Selena Gomez
7.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez, in an interview with Rolling Stone, revealed that although she never attempted suicide, she spent a few years contemplating it. "I thought the world would be better if I wasn't there," she stated. Selena, who was diagnosed with bipolar disorder, stated, "Sometimes it was weeks I'd be in bed...even walking downstairs would get me out of breath."

8.title: Several areas in Bengaluru to witness power cuts this weekend
8.article_body: Bengaluru's electricity manager, the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM), has listed areas of the city which are set to face power cuts this weekend due to several reasons, including maintenance work. Areas like Malleshwaram, Dollars Colony, Nagashetty Halli and New BEL Road will face power cuts on Saturday, while areas like Peresandra and Chikkaballapura will have power cuts on Sunday.

9.title: Mohammad Nabi steps down as Afghanistan captain after T20 World Cup 2022 exit
9.article_body: Mohammad Nabi has stepped down as Afghanistan captain after his team's T20 World Cup 2022 campaign ended without a victory. "From the last one year...our...preparation wasn't to a level...a captain would want...or needed for a big tournament," he said. He further said he wasn't on the same page with team management and selection committee in some of the last tours.

10.title: 3,18,000 Russian military reservists mobilised: Vladimir Putin
10.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that Russia had mobilised 3,18,000 military reservists, news agency Interfax reported. Kremlin had earlier said the "partial mobilisation" ordered by Putin would see 3,00,000 reservists being called up to serve in Ukraine. Russia's Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu announced last Friday that the goal to mobilise the reservists had been achieved.

11.title: 132-year-old tunnel discovered at a hospital in Mumbai, pics surface
11.article_body: A tunnel built during the British era in India has been discovered at the JJ Hospital in Mumbai. The foundation stone of the 200-metre-long tunnel mentions the year 1890. An official said the building under which it has been discovered was once used as medical ward to treat women and children, and now it's being converted into a nursing college.

12.title: Congress will cancel Agnipath scheme when it comes to power: Priyanka
12.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has stated that the party will cancel the Agnipath Army recruitment scheme when it comes to power at the Centre. "What we promise, we fulfil," she said, adding, "In Chhattisgarh, we promised farmer's loan waiver and it was implemented." She was addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra ahead of the state Assembly elections.

13.title: Leopard attacks residents in Mysuru, later rescued by forest dept
13.article_body: A video showing a leopard attacking some residents in Karnataka's Mysuru has been shared by an Indian Forest Service officer online. As per reports, the victims escaped with minor to no injuries. The leopard was reportedly captured and rescued by forest department officials. "Its only mistake was that it was seen. After which people became wild," the forest officer tweeted.

14.title: Would file defamation suit: Karan on Rajeev's allegations about dating his wife
14.article_body: Karan Mehra opened up after Rajeev Sen accused his wife, Charu Asopa, of having an affair with him. Karan said he would rather file a defamation suit against Rajeev. "I had spoken to Charu...at a promotional event in June," he said. "Prior to the event...I...met Charu about 10 years ago," he added. "What romance is Rajeev talking about?" Karan questioned.

15.title: Pune Police arrest couple for illegal money lending
15.article_body: Pune City Police have arrested a couple for allegedly lending money illegally and threatening to kill a borrower. The accused are residents of Dhayari and were identified as Jairam Nivrutti Pokale, 43, and Hema Jairam Pokale, 36. The couple lent ₹6.75 lakh to the victim and even after they were repaid ₹9.45 lakh, the accused demanded more money.

16.title: SC to hear plea seeking intervention on Delhi's worsening air on Nov 10
16.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday said on November 10 it will hear a plea seeking its "urgent intervention" to control the worsening air quality in Delhi. Advocate Shashank Shekhar Jha has filed the petition. Jha said Air Quality Index (AQI) has gone above 500 and that healthy people were also having breathing issues.

17.title: I'm going on 30-day verbal fast, no alcohol, no adult films or intercourse: Kanye West
17.article_body: Rapper Kanye West said that he will be taking a "verbal fast". Announcing a "30-day cleanse", Kanye tweeted, "I'm not talking to [nobody] for a month." "I'm taking a 30 day cleanse. A verbal fast. No alcohol. No adult films. No intercourse. In God we praise. Amen. But my Twitter still lit," his post read.

18.title: Pune civic body to extend door-to-door waste collection initiative
18.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to extend its door-to-door waste collection initiative at a cost of ₹5 crore for the first year of extension. "The agreement of PMC with Swachh Cooperative (organisation of waste pickers) is coming to an end and hence the civic administration has proposed to extend it by five years," said Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar.

19.title: Thane authority plans ₹100 crore city makeover in next 2.5 months
19.article_body: The Thane civic authority is planning to spend ₹100 crore to beautify the city with paintings and colourful illuminations in the next two and a half months. The authority will also focus on clearing construction debris and abandoned vehicles parked in the city. A 25-metre-tall 'pillar of lights' is being constructed on either side of the Anandnagar toll plaza.

20.title: Fridge explodes at Tamil Nadu home, 3 siblings suffocate to death
20.article_body: Three siblings died and two other persons were hospitalised due to asphyxiation after a refrigerator exploded at their residence in Tamil Nadu on Friday. Neighbours reportedly broke open the apartment's door. "We suspect there must have been a blast in the air compressor of the refrigerator caused either due to a short circuit or wire malfunctioning," a police officer said.

21.title: Shah Rukh Khan pushed his body to breaking point for 'Pathaan': Director
21.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand, speaking about Shah Rukh Khan's physical transformation for 'Pathaan', said that he "pushed his body to breaking point" for the action-thriller film. He added that the way Shah Rukh has endured all the pain to pull off the action is unbelievable. Siddharth further said the actor deserves all the love that he's getting for the film's teaser.

22.title: I was told 'whoever debuted with Salman didn't last long': Sonakshi
22.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha, when asked about being told 'whoever debuted alongside Salman Khan didn't have a long-lasting career', said, "This (is) such a sad thing to a newcomer who's just about to start their life." "It was very random at that point of time...I concentrated on...work and that's the only way," she added. Sonakshi made her debut with Salman-starrer 'Dabangg'.

23.title: Ambition is fine, manner of approach is what matters: Gehlot
23.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, without naming anyone, said while it is reasonable to have ambition in politics, it is the approach that makes the difference. He further refused to comment on any alleged internal conflict within the party. The remark comes after former Deputy CM Sachin Pilot pushed the Congress to end the "state of indecision" over the CM post.

24.title: Twitter starts laying off employees in India, fires entire marketing department: Report
24.article_body: Twitter has started laying off employees in India as part of a global job cut ordered by the social media platform's new owner Elon Musk. Twitter has sacked the entire marketing department in India, as per a report. Musk took over the company in a $44-billion deal last week and fired CEO Parag Agrawal and other executives.

25.title: No one seems to care: Biocon chief on condition of B'luru's Hosur Road
25.article_body: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw on Friday said that no one seems to care about the condition of Bengaluru's Hosur Road. She tagged Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari and tweeted, "NHAI...isn't doing a great job of [maintaining] Hosur Road. The median is shoddy [and] no one seems to care." She further stated that Bengaluru needs world-class national highways.

26.title: IndiGo Q2 loss widens to ₹1,583.3 cr, revenue surges by 122.8%
26.article_body: InterGlobe Aviation, parent company of IndiGo, reported that net loss in the second quarter widened to ₹1,583.3 crore from ₹1,435.7 crore in the same quarter of previous fiscal. However, the aviation company's revenue from operations increased by 122.8% to ₹12,497.6 crore, compared with ₹5,608.49 crore from the year-ago period. IndiGo reported that passenger numbers jumped by 75.9% to 1.97 crore.

27.title: 3 arrested, contraband drugs worth ₹17 crore seized: Delhi Police
27.article_body: Three persons, including a Nigerian national, were arrested and contraband drugs worth ₹17 crore have been seized from them, said the Special Cell of Delhi Police. The police seized 241 gm of cocaine and 2 kg of heroin from the accused's possession. "The drugs used to be trafficked from Latin America to Africa to India via aerial routes," police said.

28.title: We are too obsessed with money as opposed to content: Abhishek Bachchan
28.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan believes that the film industry has become "far too obsessed about collections and money as opposed to the content". Talking about OTT platforms, Bachchan said, "Fortunately, digital platforms do not put out numbers. It keeps the focus on content." He added, "Good content will always work no matter the medium."

29.title: 5 pigs test positive for African Swine Fever in MP's Katni
29.article_body: As many as five pigs tested positive for African Swine Fever in Madhya Pradesh's Katni, an official said. After the pigs tested positive, a prohibitory order was also issued in the district. "Two zones have been formed for the prevention of the disease. One is 'Infected zone'...and the other is 'Surveillance zone'," Deputy Director of Veterinary Department RK Singh said.

30.title: Bikaji Foods International's ₹881.2 cr IPO subscribed 1.48 times on day 2
30.article_body: Bikaji Foods International's ₹881.2-crore IPO was subscribed 1.48 times on the second day of bidding as it received bids for 3.04 crore equity shares against an offer size of 2.06 crore shares. The portion of the IPO reserved for retail investors was subscribed 2.33 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was booked 1.42 times as of 6 pm on Friday.

31.title: Income Tax Dept raids residences of 2 Congress MLAs in Jharkhand
31.article_body: Around 30-35 officials of the Income Tax Department conducted raids at the residence of Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal alias Anup Singh in Jharkhand's Dhori on Friday. Premises of Congress MLA Pradeep Yadav in the state were also searched. The searches were reportedly conducted over tax evasion charges. "The searches were carried out under the pressure of the BJP," Jaimangal alleged.

32.title: GHMC to contribute 5% more towards maintenance charges for parks
32.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to increase the maintenance charges by 5% that it pays for 730 colony parks and 34 tree parks from 2023. GHMC used to contribute 75% of the cost of maintaining colony parks, with welfare associations covering the remaining 25%. This will reportedly impose an additional burden of over ₹2.50 crore on GHMC.

33.title: Policemen may lose jobs if found intoxicated on duty: Assam DGP
33.article_body: Assam DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta has warned that policemen in the state may lose their jobs if found intoxicated during duty hours. New rules will be introduced to check the wrongdoings of policemen who don't work sincerely, he added. He stressed that police should be friendly with the public and shouldn't call people to the police station for petty matters.

34.title: Acting leader of Muslim Brotherhood dies at 85, group says
34.article_body: The acting leader of Egypt's banned Muslim Brotherhood, Ibrahim Munir, passed away on Friday, the Islamist organisation said on its website. Munir died in London at the age of 85. He had been living in exile for most of the last 40 years. The Muslim Brotherhood won Egypt's presidential elections in 2012 but was overthrown by the military in 2013.

35.title: 3 men pose as CBI officers, rob 4 men of ₹6.28 lakh in Mumbai
35.article_body: Mumbai Police are searching for three men who pretended to be CBI officers and robbed four men on their way to the airport to take a flight to Abu Dhabi on Tuesday. The victims were robbed of cash, goods and valuables worth ₹6.28 lakh. As per the complainant's statement, the accused started beating him and snatched his mobile phone.

36.title: Guinea's junta orders legal action against ex-Prez on graft charges
36.article_body: Guinea's military junta on Thursday ordered the initiation of legal action against former President Alpha Conde and over 180 officials from his deposed government for alleged corruption, according to a public document. Conde's government was overthrown last year. The junta's opponents have accused it of targeting Conde's old allies in order to prevent them from contesting the next elections.

37.title: Pune constable attacks woman shopkeeper over parking; suspended
37.article_body: Pune Police have suspended a constable for allegedly beating up a woman shopkeeper over a motorcycle parking issue. The constable had parked his motorcycle outside the woman's shop. When she objected to it, saying it would cause inconvenience for her customers, he started abusing her and assaulted her later. The woman has sustained serious injuries to her right eye.

38.title: Go to Pakistan, don't create it in Bihar: BJP to CM Nitish Kumar
38.article_body: The BJP has criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for his intentions to restore Urdu in schools and accused him of "creating Pakistan" in the state. "In the Muslim-dominated districts...lives of Dalits, OBCs and EBCs get ruined...go to Pakistan yourself," said the Bihar BJP. Kumar had earlier claimed that the Centre was doing little work apart from propaganda for poor states.

39.title: 25-year-old Indian man's post after getting fired from Twitter goes viral
39.article_body: Elon Musk-owned Twitter has started firing employees. A 25-year old Indian man named Yash Agarwal, who got sacked, shared a smiling picture and tweeted, "Just got laid off. Bird App, it was an absolute honour, the greatest privilege ever to be a part of this team...#LoveWhereYouWorked #LoveTwitter." He worked as a Public Policy Associate for Twitter India and South Asia.

40.title: 'Terrorists to arrive in Haji Ali', hoax caller tells Mumbai Police; apprehended
40.article_body: A 36-year-old mentally unstable man was apprehended for making a hoax call to the control room of the Mumbai Police. "The caller...said that terrorists are going to come in Haji Ali...after which a search was done...but we did not find anything suspicious." police said. The police interrogated the man but no FIR was registered and he was sent home.

41.title: She doesn't like violence, prefers to go to Parliament: Abhishek on mom Jaya
41.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said his mother, veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, has refused to watch his show 'Breathe: Into the Shadows' as she doesn't like "that kind of aggression and violence". "So she prefers to go to Parliament where none of that happens," he added. Abhishek further said his father Amitabh Bachchan "binge-watched the series".

42.title: 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans raised at BSP rally in UP; video emerges
42.article_body: A video purportedly showing people raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans during a Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) rally in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh has surfaced on social media. The rally was organised to campaign for local body elections in Jahanaganj area. Police on Friday detained BSP election candidate Pappu Khan and one of his supporters named Khursheed Ahmed in connection with the case.

43.title: We're aiming to remove range anxiety in EV riders: Taiwan's Gogoro
43.article_body: Taiwan-based Gogoro has partnered with Gurugram-based Zypp Electric, an EV-as-a-Service providing platform, to launch a battery-swapping pilot in India. The companies will launch the B2B program in December in New Delhi with 100 electric scooters. "We're aiming to remove range anxiety in riders. Through our technology, one can go up to 100 kms on every swap," said CEO of Gogoro.

44.title: Less than 1/3rd of Mumbai's bridges in good condition: BMC audit
44.article_body: As per an ongoing audit by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), less than one-third of the bridges in the city are in sound condition. Of the 340 bridges audited, 54 are in dilapidated condition and need reconstruction. "Audit is an ongoing process and recommendation in the report is not the final word," said Sanjay Kaundanyapure, chief of the bridges department.

45.title: Australia defeat Afghanistan by 4 runs, go 2nd on T20 WC 2022 Super 12 points table
45.article_body: Australia defeated Afghanistan by four runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Friday. With the victory, Australia jumped to the second place on the Group 1 points table with seven points. Australia will qualify for the semi-finals if England lose to Sri Lanka. New Zealand have already qualified for the semi-finals from the group.

46.title: Was told Judaai would fail, audience won't accept Sridevi as Anil's wife: Boney
46.article_body: Boney Kapoor revealed that people predicted that 1997 film 'Judaai' featuring Anil Kapoor and Sridevi would flop. "Everybody said...Judaai will bomb at...box office...They said how will people digest the fact...[Sridevi] is married to me, but on screen, she plays Anil's (Kapoor, his brother) wife," he added. 'Judaai', which was reportedly made on a budget of ₹6.3 crore, collected ₹28.77 crore.

47.title: Garmin appoints Yeshudas Pillai as new Country Head for India
47.article_body: US-based wearable brand Garmin's Indian unit has announced the appointment of Yeshudas Pillai as the new Country Head for its operations. In this role, he will be driving stakeholder engagement, growth, and development of the brand in India, according to a statement by Garmin. Garmin aims to add seven new brand stores in the country by 2023.

48.title: Former Meta India head Ajit Mohan joins Snap as Asia Pacific President
48.article_body: Meta's former India head Ajit Mohan is joining Snapchat parent Snap as its President for the Asia Pacific (APAC) region, the company's CEO Evan Spiegel said. "Ajit will provide in-market leadership, lead cross-functional efforts across the region, oversee local operations, and lead our go-to-market strategy," Spiegel said. Meta on Thursday announced that Mohan has resigned after nearly four years.

49.title: Vietnam to remove 'false' content from social media in 24 hours
49.article_body: Vietnam’s Minister of Information and Communications Nguyen Manh Hung has said that "false" content on social media must be taken down within 24 hours, instead of 48 hours previously. Hung told the Parliament that false news spreads widely if handled slowly. He added that penalties in Vietnam for spreading misinformation are one-tenth of level imposed by other Southeast Asian nations.

50.title: Tesla's ex-India policy head Manuj Khurana to join Ather Energy: Report
50.article_body: Tesla's former India Policy and Business Development Chief Manuj Khurana is reportedly joining electric scooter startup Ather Energy. Khurana joined Tesla in March 2021 and quit the US electric automaker in June. He will join Ather as a vice president. Ather raised $128 million from investors, including Hero MotoCorp and the National Investment & Infrastructure Fund this year.

51.title: 57 out of 100 wards reserved in Ghaziabad for civic polls
51.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has finalised the list of reserved wards for the upcoming municipal elections and sent it for approval. As many as 57 wards out of the total 100 have been reserved, with 14 wards being reserved for the SC category, 21 for the OBC category and 22 for women candidates, Municipal Commissioner Nitin Gaur said on Thursday.

52.title: India calls for more clarity on definition of climate finance
52.article_body: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change said more clarity is needed on definition of climate finance for developing countries to assess the extent required for climate action. Ahead of the COP27 climate summit, the ministry added, "The goal of $100 billion/year of climate finance by 2020 and every year thereafter through till 2025 is yet to be achieved."

53.title: Video shows Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri bleeding after being shot in Amritsar
53.article_body: A video shows Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri bleeding on the ground after being shot at in Punjab's Amritsar. Some people can be seen rushing to help him. The Shiv Sena leader, who reportedly sustained two bullet injuries, passed away, said a police official. The accused has been arrested, police added.

54.title: Russia likely shooting its own retreating soldiers: UK
54.article_body: The UK's Defence Ministry said that Russian forces have probably started deploying "barrier troops" or "blocking units" that "threaten to shoot their own retreating soldiers" fighting in Ukraine. "These units have been used in previous conflicts by Russian forces," it added. "The tactic of shooting deserters likely attests to the...low morale and indiscipline of Russian forces," it further said.

55.title: Farmers are backbone of rising India: Vice President Dhankhar
55.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar said that farmers are the backbone of a rising India and also credited industry for driving the agriculture sector on a new trajectory. "Bharat is on the rise [like] never before. It [has] a global recognition…It is the [farmers] who need to be well informed so that [they] adopt economically sustainable measures," said Dhankhar.

56.title: AAP failing to curb air pollution in Delhi: Piyush Goyal
56.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal criticised AAP for air pollution in Delhi and said that people would vote against them. "Despite their big assurances, the state [Delhi] government is failing at all fronts, whether it is air pollution levels, keeping a check on corruption, improving infrastructure, or fulfilling its promises. Delhi residents are...fed up with their hollow promises," said Goyal.

57.title: Umpiring blunder leads to 5-ball over during Australia's innings against Afghanistan
57.article_body: An umpiring blunder led to a five-ball over during Australia's innings against Afghanistan in T20 World Cup 2022. A delivery in the over was mistakenly counted twice on broadcast graphic after David Warner and Mitchell Marsh ran overthrow. Umpires then called 'over' after just five balls were bowled. The score was later corrected, but Australia's innings remained a ball short.

58.title: US-based company Opendoor to lay off nearly 550 employees
58.article_body: US-based property-selling firm Opendoor will lay off about 550 employees, the company's Chief Executive Officer Eric Wu said. "We're navigating one of the most challenging real estate markets in 40 years and need to adjust our business," Wu said. He added that the company earlier scaled back its capacity by over 830 positions, primarily by reducing third-party resourcing.

59.title: India's high crypto tax may kill the industry there: Binance CEO
59.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has said that India's high taxes on cryptocurrency transactions may "kill the industry" in the country. Zhao made the comments during a fintech conference in Singapore. His remarks come months after the Indian government introduced a 30% tax on gains from cryptocurrencies. The government also mandated a 1% tax deduction at source on all crypto transactions.

60.title: Man who threw stones at local train & loco pilot in Chennai held
60.article_body: The railway police arrested a 31-year-old man, K Boopalan, for allegedly throwing stones at a local train and its loco pilot in Chennai after the video of the incident from October 21 surfaced online. The loco pilot was reportedly injured in the attack. According to a press release, Boopalan is accused in several cases including murder, wrongful restraint and dacoity.

61.title: Titan's Q2 profit grows by 33% to ₹857 crore, revenue up by 22%
61.article_body: Titan Company on Friday posted a year-on-year growth of 33% in its standalone profit at ₹857 crore for the September quarter as against ₹641 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. Its standalone revenue grew by 21.8% year-on-year to ₹8,730 crore from ₹7,170 crore. On Friday, Titan's stock on BSE closed 0.18% higher at ₹2,768.30 per share.

62.title: Twitter staff start losing access to work emails & devices amid layoffs, share pics
62.article_body: Several Twitter employees are reporting that they have lost access to their work emails and devices ahead of the company's official email confirming whether or not they will be laid off on Friday. Many of them took to Twitter to share that they had been laid off. Internally, the employees were referring to the layoffs as Thanos' 'Snap' from Avengers.

63.title: Xiaomi misled Deutsche Bank on illegal royalty payments: ED
63.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has accused the India unit of Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corporation of misleading its banker Deutsche Bank for years by claiming it had an agreement for payment of royalties when it had none, according to legal documents. Xiaomi is involved in a face off with ED since the latter froze $670 million of its bank assets.

64.title: Punjab's stubble burning converted Delhi into gas chamber: LG Saxena
64.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena criticised Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann over air pollution in the city and said that stubble burning in Punjab converted Delhi into a gas chamber. He also asked Mann to take "substantive" measures to control the stubble burning. "The cases of stubble burning [in Punjab] have not only continued unabated but increased tragically," said Saxena.

65.title: Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri shot dead in Amritsar
65.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri was shot dead in Punjab's Amritsar on Friday. "Sudhir Suri was shot outside Gopal Mandir, Amritsar during some agitation. He sustained bullet injuries and was rushed to hospital and died," said a police official. The accused has been arrested and his weapons have been seized, police added.

66.title: 14,000 arrested in Iran over anti-hijab protests in last 6 weeks: UN
66.article_body: At least 14,000 people were arrested in Iran during anti-hijab protests over the last six weeks, the UN said. According to Javaid Rehman, Special Rapporteur on the Situation of Human Rights in Iran, those arrested include students, lawyers, journalists. Protests are taking place in Iran over 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini's death who was detained by morality police over improper hijab.

67.title: Delhi's MCD elections to be held on December 4; results on December 7
67.article_body: Delhi Municipal Corporation elections will be held on December 4 and the results will be declared on December 7, the state election commission announced on Friday. The polls were originally scheduled to be held in the first half of 2022. The elections were postponed after the Centre decided to unify three erstwhile municipal corporations into the MCD.

68.title: Pic of Kerala IAS officer holding her son in arms while giving speech goes viral
68.article_body: A photo shows Kerala IAS officer Divya S Iyer holding her three-and-a-half-year old son in her arms while delivering a speech. She brought her son to the valedictory ceremony of a private film festival. While some pointed out at 'propriety', others backed Iyer. Her husband KS Sabarinadhan, a former legislator, said she took her child as the function was unofficial.

69.title: Delhi reeling under 'pollution of corruption': BJP's Sambit Patra
69.article_body: As air quality in Delhi continued to remain in the "severe" category for the second consecutive day, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra criticised CM Arvind Kejriwal, claiming that his "intent and integrity" are polluted and that the city is reeling under the "pollution of corruption". "There has been an increase of 34% in stubble burning in Punjab," said Patra.

70.title: Two awarded death penalty for minor's gang rape, attempt to kill in UP
70.article_body: A POCSO court in UP's Pratapgarh awarded death penalty to two accused for gang rape and attempted murder of an 11-year-old girl. The incident took place last year when three people, including a minor, gang raped the girl, threw her on the railway track and ran away, damaging her left eye and bones of her face and leg.

71.title: Boulder falls on home in J&K during landslide; woman, daughter killed
71.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her 12-year-old daughter were killed after a boulder fell on their house following a landslide in the Dooner area in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch, officials said. A total of four persons were injured, following which they were rushed to a hospital in Surankote. The woman and her minor daughter succumbed to injuries, officials added.

72.title: PUMA invites #KohliCrew to co-create Virat Kohli's mural on his birthday
72.article_body: As Virat Kohli turns 34 on November 5, fans are gearing up to celebrate their hero's birthday in Mumbai by creating a massive mural at Carter Road on Saturday, stated Puma, adding that people are also dedicating special artworks, haircuts, tattoos and more on social media using the hashtag #KohliCrew.

73.title: Cash management company driver runs away with vehicle containing ₹31 lakh
73.article_body: A driver working with a cash management company ran away with a vehicle containing ₹31 lakh in Hyderabad. The incident took place on Thursday when the company staff had gone to refill an ATM machine with cash. When four employees got down to refill cash, the driver ran away with the vehicle, reports said.

74.title: Climate activists who break law must be prosecuted quickly: German minister
74.article_body: Germany's Interior Minister Nancy Faeser told the German Press Agency that climate activists who break the law must be prosecuted quickly and consequently. "These activists place themselves above the law and resort to means that do not benefit the important cause of climate protection," Faeser said. She mentioned an incident in Berlin where protesters glued themselves to a gantry sign.

75.title: GAIL's Q2 profit falls by 46% to ₹1,537 cr, revenue up by 78%
75.article_body: GAIL (India) Limited on Friday reported a 46% year-on-year decline in standalone profit at ₹1,537 crore for the September quarter against ₹2,862.95 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. Its revenue from operations surged by 78% year-on-year to ₹38,479 crore. Sequentially, revenue gained 2.4% from June quarter's ₹37,562 crore. At 3:12 pm, its stock was trading 1.99% lower on BSE.

76.title: Hyderabad man gets 15 days in jail for abusing traffic policeman
76.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad sentenced a man, G Haridas, to 15 days imprisonment for abusing a traffic sub-inspector after he asked the accused to clear pending challans. The court also imposed a fine of ₹500 on him. Haridas was stopped by traffic police at Begumpet on September 9 during a special drive conducted to clear traffic challans on vehicles.

77.title: No job is unimportant: Mahindra on support staff cleaning Team India players' shoes
77.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra praised India's throwdown specialist Raghu who was seen cleaning Indian players' shoes during their rain-curtailed T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh. "In any community or organisation, there is NO job that is unimportant or irrelevant," Mahindra tweeted. He also said that the picture of Raghu carrying a brush during the match was "pic of the week".

78.title: Utter bullshit: Charu on being accused of having affair with Karan Mehra
78.article_body: After Rajeev Sen accused her of having an affair with actor Karan Mehra, Charu Asopa said, "This is utter bullshit." She also apologised to Karan for "getting involved in this messy thing". "He (Rajeev) is trying to malign his image as well. I'm feeling so bad about it...My husband is really getting dirty and making it ugly," Charu said.

79.title: 1 killed, 1 injured as neighbours fight over water in Mumbai
79.article_body: One person was killed and another person was injured in a fight between neighbours over filling water in Mumbai as both of them fell off the second floor. The deceased, 26-year-old Sadiq Ansari, and the accused, 28-year-old Tushar Singh, were residents of an apartment in Bhiwandi. "Ansari fell on his head which caused severe bleeding and...Singh...suffered some injuries," police said.

80.title: We can't put China and Russia on the same level: EU top diplomat
80.article_body: European Union's (EU) Foreign Policy Chief Josep Borrell on Friday said that Western countries need to reduce their dependency on China but the country cannot be put on the same level as Russia. "It is clear that China is consolidating a new era of its external policy, and internal also, [that] China [is] becoming much more assertive," he added.

81.title: Russia becomes India's largest supplier of crude oil: Report
81.article_body: Russia reportedly became India's largest supplier of crude oil in October. India imported 1.07 million barrels per day (bpd) of crude from Russia last month, up nearly 5% from 1.02 million bpd in September, as per estimates by cargo tracking and analytical services provider Vortexa. However, Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri recently said Iraq was India's largest supplier last month.

82.title: New Zealand become first team to qualify for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals
82.article_body: New Zealand, who are on top of the Super 12 stage Group 1 table with seven points, have officially become the first team to qualify for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals. This comes as Australia managed a total of 168/8 in their Super 12 match against Afghanistan, meaning they cannot go beyond New Zealand's net run-rate in Group 1.

83.title: Mumbai suburban railway ridership still below pre-pandemic levels: Officials
83.article_body: Central Railway's Mumbai suburban network is yet to reach the pre-pandemic ridership levels. According to CR officials, the option of work-from-home given by employers has been a factor along with other causes like the permanent migration of the labour class. An official said that 37 lakh commuters are presently being ferried, while this figure was 45 lakh before COVID-19.

84.title: Inspector attacks policemen after being caught cheating on wife in Hyd
84.article_body: The wife of an inspector allegedly caught him cheating on her with another woman in a car in Hyderabad on Thursday night. When Vanasthalipuram Police arrived at the scene and tried to take Inspector Raju into custody, he attacked and injured a constable and a home guard. However, police officials overpowered Raju and later booked him for attacking the policemen.

85.title: Russian commander criticised for troop performance goes on 3-week holiday: Report
85.article_body: A Russian military district commander, Alexander Lapin, criticised for the performance of his troops in Ukraine, has gone on a three-week holiday, a regional news agency reported. Last month, Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov said Lapin should be stripped of his medals and sent to the front with a gun to wash away his shame with blood.

86.title: Arjun shares old pic with Janhvi, praises her performance in 'Mili'
86.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram and penned a note praising Janhvi Kapoor's performance in 'Mili'. Sharing an old picture with the actress, he wrote, "You're brilliant in #Mili - what a spine-chilling act." "You continue to make me prouder. Your growth as an actor, as a star is phenomenal...And you are just getting started which is...really exciting," Arjun added.

87.title: Attempt to murder case accused escapes police custody in Gurugram
87.article_body: An accused in an attempt to murder case on Wednesday night fled from a hospital in Gurugram's South City-1 area where he was undergoing treatment, escaping police custody, police said on Friday. Praveen Sharma managed to escape from the hospital on the pretext of using the washroom, police added. A head constable has been booked for negligence in the case.

88.title: 2 men make people sign cheques with erasable ink pen in Noida, cheat them
88.article_body: Noida Police have arrested two people for allegedly posing as bank executives and making them sign cancelled cheques with a pen with erasable ink. "The suspects withdraw an amount from the bank account of the victims," police said. The matter came to light when a complainant informed the police that ₹2 lakh was debited from his account.

89.title: Who is Isudan Gadhvi, AAP's CM face for Gujarat elections?
89.article_body: The National Joint General Secretary of Aam Aadmi Party, Isudan Gadhvi, was declared the party's Chief Ministerial candidate for the Gujarat Assembly elections. Before venturing into politics, Gadhvi was a popular Gujarati journalist. He has worked as an anchor on the prime-time news show 'Mahamanthan' on VTV Gujarati. The 40-year-old leader hails from a farmer family in Dwarka's Pipliya village.

90.title: All FIRs against ex-BJP leader over Prophet remarks transferred to Delhi Police
90.article_body: The Supreme Court has directed that all FIRs against expelled BJP leader Naveen Kumar Jindal over his alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad should be transferred to Delhi Police's Intelligence Fusion and Strategic Operations unit. "No precipitative action or further FIRs against the accused for eight weeks so he can pursue his appropriate remedy before the Delhi HC," SC said.

91.title: 2 20-yr-old students die after losing control of bike on Hyd flyover
91.article_body: Two 20-year-old students riding a motorcycle died after losing control of the vehicle while passing through Hyderabad's Adikmet Flyover on Friday morning. Police said N Bhavan and M Roshan were going at high speed when the vehicle skidded. A total of six friends on three bikes were going to Nallakunta. The deceased were BBA students at a college in Nallakunta.

92.title: Karnataka residents can now register FIR for vehicle thefts online: Police
92.article_body: Karnataka police on Thursday announced that the residents of the state can now register an FIR online if their two-wheeler or four-wheeler is stolen. To file the e-FIR, one must sign up to the state police's Citizen Centric Portal. After logging in, click on the 'vehicle theft' option under the e-FIR category to register the complaint.

93.title: Cipla's September quarter profit rises by 11% y-o-y to ₹789 crore
93.article_body: Pharmaceutical major Cipla on Friday posted a 10.9% year-on-year growth in consolidated net profit of ₹788.9 crore for the quarter ended September. It also reported a 5.6% year-on-year rise in consolidated revenue from operations to ₹5,828.4 crore. Its consolidated margins came in at 22.3% and its EBITDA stood at ₹1,303 crore during the quarter.

94.title: I will 'very, very, very probably' run for US President again in 2024: Trump
94.article_body: Ex-US President Donald Trump said he'll "very, very, very probably" run for President again in 2024. Addressing a rally ahead of next week's midterm elections, he said, "This is the year we're going to take back the House...We're going to take back...Senate. We're going to take back America and then in 2024...we're going to take back our magnificent White House."

95.title: BMC to train and give certificates to domestic helpers in Mumbai
95.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to train domestic helpers and women from lower-income groups in cooking and medical attendant work. It will also provide certificates upon the completion of their seven-day course. According to the eligibility criteria, the women should hold yellow or orange ration cards and should be earning less than ₹1 lakh per annum.

96.title: NHRC summons Chief Secretaries of Delhi and 3 states over air pollution
96.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has summoned Chief Secretaries of Delhi, Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh on November 10 to discuss ways of tackling the air pollution menace in the NCR region. "The Chief Secretaries...are expected to inform the commission...about the steps taken by their respective governments to stop the [stubble burning] in their regions," said NHRC.

97.title: Ranveer Singh parts ways with his management agency YRF Talent after 12 years: Reports
97.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has amicably parted ways with Yash Raj Films' talent management agency, YRF Talent, after 12 years, as per reports. He made his debut with Maneesh Sharma's 'Band Baaja Baaraat', bankrolled by Yash Raj Films in 2010. The actor will collaborate with the production house as and when possible, reports added.

98.title: Technology has spoiled on-field umpires, their job is not just to hold sweaters: Akram
98.article_body: Wasim Akram has said that technology has spoiled on-field umpires, adding that they have become "too relaxed" due to over-reliance on third umpires. "I'm all for technology, but if on-field umpires are standing, they also have a job. Their job isn't just to hold sweaters," he added. Akram added that on-field umpires have consistently erred in T20 World Cup 2022.

99.title: Pic of Rajinikanth's lookalike from Pakistan goes viral
99.article_body: A picture of a retired government official from Pakistan who resembles Indian superstar Rajinikanth has gone viral on social media. "After I retired, I started using social media where many people started calling me by that name (Rajinikanth)...I realised that God had blessed me with the looks of a great actor and human being," he said.

100.title: Ravindra Jadeja likely to continue with CSK after MS Dhoni's demand: Reports
100.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is likely to continue with Chennai Super Kings (CSK) after MS Dhoni's demand, as per reports. Jadeja was reportedly not happy at the franchise after being removed as captain mid-way during IPL 2022. As per reports, Dhoni told CSK management that Jadeja's influence cannot be replicated by another player and that he cannot be released.

101.title: Activists jailed for attacking 'Girl with a Pearl Earring' painting in The Hague
101.article_body: A Dutch court has sentenced two Belgian climate activists to two months in prison, one of which is suspended, for attacking the renowned 'Girl with a Pearl Earring' painting in The Hague, Netherlands. On October 27, three climate activists had targeted Dutch painter Johannes Vermeer's painting with glue and tomato soup. The third activist will appear in court on Friday.

102.title: AAP declares Isudan Gadhvi as Chief Minister candidate for Gujarat elections
102.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party on Friday announced Isudan Gadhvi as its Chief Ministerial candidate for next month's Gujarat Assembly elections. Last week, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal launched a campaign in Gujarat to choose the party's CM face. He had urged people to contact the party through SMS, WhatsApp, voice mail, and e-mail to give their opinion about who should be chosen.

103.title: 8 foetuses found inside 21-day-old baby in a rare medical condition in Ranchi
103.article_body: As many as eight foetuses were found in a 21-day-old baby's abdomen in a rare case of fetus-in-fetu in Ranchi, a doctor said. "As per the papers and journals available so far, one foetus was reported in most fetus-in-fetu cases. Case of eight foetuses hasn't been reported from anywhere yet," he added. The size of the foetuses ranges from 3-5cm.

104.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan's party workers shot at while protesting attack on the leader
104.article_body: Several unidentified gunmen opened fire at former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's party workers while they were protesting the attack on the leader. Several senior leaders of the party were present at the time but no one was hurt, reports said. The gunmen arrived at the spot in a jeep and opened fire at the protesters before fleeing.

105.title: Minor boy dies by suicide over abuse by father's woman partner in Pune
105.article_body: An 11-year-old boy died by suicide after being allegedly abused and harassed by his father's woman partner in Pune's Lohiyanagar, police said. The victim visited the woman's house with his father and while returning, he was abused and threatened by her and her mother, police added. The minor boy's body was later found hanging at his home, police stated.

106.title: UK facing a 'very challenging' two-year recession: Bank of England
106.article_body: The Bank of England has said that the UK is facing a "very challenging" two-year recession as it raised interest rates to 3%. This would be the longest recession since comparable records began. The Bank of England forecasts inflation will hit a 40-year high of around 11% during the current quarter.

107.title: US firm Runwise raises $19 million in a round led by Fifth Wall
107.article_body: US-based building technology company Runwise has secured $19 million in Series A round led by venture capital firm Fifth Wall. The round also saw participation from real estate owners including New York's Rudin Management and SOJA Ventures. The latest round increased the startup's total equity funding to $24 million. Runwise was founded by Lee Hoffman, Mike Cook and Jeff Carleton.

108.title: Putin orders one-time $3,200 payment for mobilised & contract soldiers
108.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a one-time payment of $3,200 for contract soldiers and those who have been mobilised to fight in Ukraine, the Kremlin said on Thursday. The payment was designed "to provide additional measures of social support", Putin said in a decree.  The minimum monthly wage for contract soldiers is $2,700, almost three times the national average.

109.title: Udaan to begin 2nd round of layoffs amid operation overhaul: Report
109.article_body: B2B e-commerce startup Udaan will fire some contractual workers and sales supervisors in the second round of layoffs as it revamps its operations, Financial Express reported. This comes a week after Udaan secured $120 million in funding through convertible notes and debt from existing investors and bondholders. In June, the unicorn laid off about 180 employees citing changing market conditions.

110.title: Which Indian states have the highest unemployment rate & which have the lowest?
110.article_body: Haryana had the highest unemployment rate of 31.8% among Indian states in the month of October, as per latest data from CMIE. It was followed by Rajasthan (30.7%), Jammu & Kashmir (22.4%), Jharkhand (16.5%), and Bihar (14.5%). Meanwhile, the states that had the lowest unemployment rates were Madhya Pradesh (0.8%), Chhattisgarh (0.9%), Odisha (1.1%), Gujarat (1.7%), and Karnataka (2.7%).

111.title: Teen found hanging in J'khand police station, officer-in-charge suspended
111.article_body: The officer-in-charge of a police station in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district has been suspended after an 18-year-old youth was found hanging inside a cell within the campus of the station. The deceased allegedly used his belt to hang himself to death, police said. The deceased was taken into custody recently for interrogation after he allegedly eloped with a minor girl.

112.title: Time to welcome Finland, Sweden to NATO: Stoltenberg to Turkish minister
112.article_body: Jens Stoltenberg, NATO Secretary-General, has urged Turkey to approve Sweden and Finland's applications to join the military alliance. Stoltenberg said the two Nordic nations had delivered on Turkey's demands and were ready to join NATO. Meanwhile, Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu said Sweden and Finland have not yet fulfilled obligations under a deal to clear their bids.

113.title: Work from home announced for 50% Delhi govt employees amid high pollution levels
113.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Friday announced that 50 per cent of Delhi government employees will be working from home amid high pollution levels in the city. Earlier today, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced the closure of primary schools in the national capital from Saturday. The schools in the city will remain closed till the pollution situation improves.

114.title: India's unemployment rate rises to 7.77% in Oct from 6.43% in Sept: CMIE
114.article_body: India's unemployment rate surged to 7.77% in October, according to the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE). It had touched a four-year low of 6.43% in September. The rise was led by an increase in the rural joblessness rate to 8.04% in October as against 5.84% in September after the kharif harvest season, while urban joblessness rate fell to 7.21%.

115.title: 66% schools didn't have internet access in 2021-22 academic year: Report
115.article_body: A report by the Ministry of Education stated that at least 55.5% of schools in the country did not have computer facilities, and 66% were without internet access in the 2021-22 academic year. According to the report, only 2.2% of the schools had digital libraries and only 14.9% of them had smart classrooms, used for virtual teaching.

116.title: NZ defeat Ireland in their last T20 WC 2022 Super 12 match, take their NRR to +2.113
116.article_body: New Zealand defeated Ireland by 35 runs in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. With this, they extended their lead at the top of the Group 1 points table with seven points and a net run-rate (NRR) of +2.113. Meanwhile, Ireland finished their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign with three points in the Super 12 stage.

117.title: Committed to addressing concerns: Lupin on USFDA warning for Tarapur plant
117.article_body: After the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) sent a warning letter to Lupin over manufacturing errors at Maharashtra's Tarapur plant, the drugmaker said, "We are committed to addressing the concerns raised by the USFDA and will work with the USFDA to resolve these issues at the earliest." It added that this wouldn't disrupt the plant's supplies or existing revenue.

118.title: King Charles had a valet for his teddy when he was in his 40s, book claims
118.article_body: UK's King Charles III was so attached to his childhood teddy bear that he had a person to look after it in his forties, according to a new book. A former nanny to the royal family was called out of retirement for its maintenance, a former valet claimed in the book titled 'The King: The Life of Charles III'.

119.title: Tihar DG Sandeep Goel transferred days after Sukesh Chandrashekar's ₹12.50 cr bribe claim
119.article_body: Days after conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar alleged that he paid ₹12.50 crore as a bribe to Tihar DG Sandeep Goel, the officer has been transferred. Delhi LG Vinai Kumar Saxena on Friday issued transfer orders for Goel. IPS Sanjay Beniwal has been appointed as the new DG of Prisons. A copy of the transfer issue surfaced online.

120.title: China & Germany should cooperate in times of turmoil: Xi tells Scholz
120.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping told German Chancellor Olaf Scholz that China and Germany should work together during "times of change and turmoil", a Chinese state broadcaster reported. During his one-day visit to China, Scholz held his first face-to-face meeting with Xi since taking office. Scholz reportedly said the Russian invasion of Ukraine was creating problems for the rule-based global order.

121.title: South Korea sends fighter jets after detecting 180 North Korean warplanes near border
121.article_body: South Korea has said that it has scrambled its fighter jets after detecting 180 North Korean warplanes near its border. South Korea scrambled 80 aircraft, including, F-35A stealth fighters, in response. About 240 aircraft participating in the Vigilant Storm air exercises with the United States continued the drills, the military said.

122.title: Urvashi Dholakia shares her pics, says 'Our bodies change with each passing day'
122.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia shared her pictures on Instagram and wrote, "From time unknown, women have been judged! From how they look, to what they wear & how they behave...I as a woman have all the right to be myself." "Our bodies change each passing day & we don't need to be judged for our shapes & sizes," she added.

123.title: Telangana CM KCR releases videos to back poaching charges against BJP
123.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Thursday released video clips to back poaching charges against the BJP. One of the videos shows the 'deal' between agents who were allegedly trying to lure four Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) MLAs to join the BJP. In the video, one of the accused Satish Sharma can be heard offering ₹50 crore each to MLAs.

124.title: Twitter sued over plan to fire 50% workforce without enough notice: Report
124.article_body: Twitter has been sued over a plan to eliminate half of its workforce, about 3,700 jobs, after Elon Musk took control of the company, Bloomberg reported. Employees alleged that Twitter is violating federal and California law by firing them without giving enough notice. Twitter will start laying off staff on Friday and has temporarily shut offices and suspended badge access.

125.title: HPCL stock falls by 4%, nears 52-week low after quarterly loss
125.article_body: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited's shares (HPCL) fell by almost 4% on Friday after the company posted a standalone net loss of ₹2,172 crore for the September quarter as against a profit of ₹1,923.5 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. It saw its worst fall in over a month and neared its 52-week low of ₹200.05 apiece on the NSE.

126.title: 19-year-old woman found dead at home in Ghaziabad, 2 brothers detained
126.article_body: Police detained two brothers of a 19-year-old woman after she was found dead at her home on Wednesday in Ghaziabad. The two admitted to killing her over her relationship with a 25-year-old man they did not approve of, police said. Notably, two audio clips, one in which the woman could be heard seeking help from her male friend, surfaced online.

127.title: Starbucks Co-founder tries filter coffee, masala dosa in B'luru, restaurant shares pics
127.article_body: Starbucks Co-founder Zev Siegl visited the famous Vidyarthi Bhavan restaurant in Bengaluru on Thursday. The restaurant took to social media to share pictures of Siegl enjoying their filter coffee and masala dosa. "It is an honour to enjoy your famous food, coffee...I will take this wonderful experience with me back to Seattle," Siegl wrote in the restaurant's guest book.

128.title: ED raids 12 places in WB, J'khand in illegal land grabbing case: Reports
128.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday raided nearly 12 places in West Bengal and Jharkhand in a money laundering case against those illegally occupying Indian Army lands, as per reports. The places where searches were conducted included the premises of a Kolkata-based businessman Amit Agrawal, reports added. Notably, ED arrested Agrawal last month in connection with a money laundering case.

129.title: 33-year-old employee dies after getting locked inside walk-in freezer in US bakery
129.article_body: A 33-year-old bakery employee has been found dead inside a walk-in freezer in US' New York after he allegedly got locked inside accidentally. The man reportedly got trapped while cleaning out the freezer in the early hours. "We are devastated by the loss of our employee in this accident...We extended our deepest condolences to [the family]," the bakery's manager said.

130.title: Amara Raja Batteries' stock surges most in a decade after Q2 results
130.article_body: Amara Raja Batteries' shares increased the most in a decade after the company reported a 39% year-on-year rise in consolidated profit for the September quarter. The company's board has also approved an interim dividend of ₹2.90/share and the record date for the same has been set for November 16. At 11:29 am, its stock was trading 10.58% higher on BSE.

131.title: Illegal parking lot busted in Gurugram's DLF Phase-2; 4 arrested
131.article_body: Gurugram Police and the CM's flying squad arrested four people for allegedly running an illegal parking lot on a municipal corporation's plot near the Rapid Metro station in DLF Phase-2. The police said that they are conducting raids to arrest the kingpins who have been running the parking lot illegally for the last three years.

132.title: We take responsibility for stubble burning in Punjab: Kejriwal and Mann on pollution
132.article_body: Amid high pollution level, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann held a joint press conference and said, "We take responsibility for the stubble burning in Punjab." Adding that this is not the time for "blame game", Kejriwal stated, "We have taken steps to control it. Stubble burning will come down by next year."

133.title: India gifts 80 vehicles to Nepal for upcoming election
133.article_body: Extending logistical support to Nepal for the conduct of the November 20 election, India on Thursday gifted 80 vehicles to Kathmandu's Election Commission. "These 80 vehicles are part of the 200 vehicles that have been provided to Nepal, at their request," Indian Embassy in Kathmandu said. "The handing over of...vehicles is reflective of close...relationship between India and Nepal," it added.

134.title: 6 local trains cancelled, 70 delayed due to technical snag in Mumbai
134.article_body: The Western Railway's suburban service was disrupted this morning due to a technical snag in Mumbai. At least six local trains were cancelled and at least 70 were delayed. Six long-distance trains were also delayed by about 30 minutes. "All...fast suburban locals are running late by 15-20 minutes. Inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," Western Railway's Mumbai division tweeted.

135.title: Pak police officers suspended for leaking confession of Imran Khan's attacker
135.article_body: Chief Minister of Pakistan's Punjab province Chaudhry Elahi has suspended police officers and other officials for leaking the confession of the suspect who shot at ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad. In a confession video, the suspect can be heard saying he "wanted to kill only Imran Khan and no one else" because "he was misleading people".

136.title: Man kicks 6-yr-old in the chest for leaning on his car in Kerala; arrested
136.article_body: A man has been arrested after a video showing him kicking a six-year-old boy in the chest for leaning on his car went viral on social media. Police has registered a case against the man, Shihshad, a resident of Ponnyampalam. Assembly Speaker AN Shamseer said stringent action would be taken against the accused.

137.title: Ireland's Josh Little breaks world record for taking most T20I wickets in a single year
137.article_body: Ireland's 23-year-old fast bowler Josh Little has broken the world record for taking most wickets in T20I cricket in a calendar year. With his hat-trick against New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2022 on Friday, Little took his tally of wickets in T20I cricket in 2022 to 39. He overtook Nepal's Sandeep Lamichhane, who has taken 38 wickets in 2022.

138.title: Reliance in talks to buy 49% stake in Naturals Salon & Spa: Report
138.article_body: The retail arm of Reliance Industries, Reliance Retail, is looking to enter the salon business by buying a 49% stake in the Chennai-based Groom India Salon & Spa, the Naturals Salon & Spa parent, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Confirming the development, CEO of Naturals Salon & Spa CK Kumaravel said that the negotiations are at a 'nascent stage'.

139.title: Delhi primary schools to be shut from tomorrow amid high pollution levels
139.article_body: Primary schools in Delhi will remain shut from tomorrow amid high pollution levels in the national capital, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced on Friday. Schools will remain closed till pollution situation in national capital improves. Schools in Noida and Greater Noida also decided to hold online classes for students of Classes 1-8 till November 8 in view of rising pollution.

140.title: Ireland become first team to produce 2 hat-tricks in T20 World Cup history
140.article_body: Ireland have became the first team to produce two hat-tricks in T20 World Cup history. Ireland's 23-year-old pacer Josh Little dismissed New Zealand's Kane Williamson, Jimmy Neesham and Mitchell Santner on Friday to take Ireland's second hat-trick in T20 World Cup history. Curtis Campher was the first Irish bowler to take a T20 World Cup hat-trick.

141.title: Apple starts manufacturing iPhone 14 at a second plant in India: Report
141.article_body: Apple's Taiwanese contract manufacturer Pegatron has begun assembling the new iPhone 14 in India, Bloomberg reported. The move makes Pegatron the second Apple supplier to manufacture the iPhone 14 in India, months after Foxconn started its production near Chennai. Notably, the world's largest iPhone plant situated in China's Zhengzhou was recently placed under lockdown after COVID-19 outbreak.

142.title: Sushmita Sen told me if I'm happy without Rajeev, I should separate: Sister-in-law Charu
142.article_body: After initiating divorce proceedings again against Rajeev Sen, actress Charu Asopa said that her sister-in-law Sushmita Sen has always told her to prioritise her own happiness. "She (Sushmita) has said that if I'm happier with Rajeev, then that's what I should do, but if I'm happier away from him, then I should separate," Charu said.

143.title: Apple halts hiring for roles outside R&D to cut costs: Report
143.article_body: Apple has paused hiring for several jobs outside of research and development under its plan to cut costs, Bloomberg reported. It made the decision to freeze hiring last month ahead of its quarterly earnings report. Apple said it continues to hire but given the current economic environment it's taking "a very deliberate approach" in some parts of the business.

144.title: Morbi Nagar Palika chief officer suspended over bridge collapse: Reports
144.article_body: The chief officer of Gujarat's Morbi Nagar Palika Sandipsinh Zala has reportedly been suspended following the Morbi bridge collapse incident that killed 135 persons. Police have arrested nine persons in connection with the incident so far. An Oreva Group manager, Deepak Parekh, who is among those arrested earlier said it was "the will of God" that the incident took place.

145.title: 6 health workers terminated after dog licks blood of patient in UP hospital
145.article_body: Services of six health workers were terminated after a video of a dog licking the blood of a patient in a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kushinagar went viral. Reports said that Kushinagar district magistrate, S Raj Lingam, issued the termination orders. Lingam also sought an explanation from the chief medical superintendent and two medical officers.

146.title: 5-day search operation after Morbi suspension bridge collapse called off
146.article_body: The Gujarat government has called off the five-day search operation that was launched after the collapse of the suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi. More than 130 people lost their lives in the incident. State Commissioner of Relief Harshad Patel visited Morbi and announced the end of the search operation, reports said.

147.title: Morgan Stanley to begin layoffs in coming weeks globally: Report
147.article_body: Morgan Stanley is expected to begin a fresh round of layoffs globally in coming weeks, Reuters reported citing people familiar with the plan. In Asia Pacific, the bank has reportedly drafted a list of staff members considered redundant, who mainly work with teams that focus on China-related business. The bank is yet to decide on scale and timing of layoffs.

148.title: When India play, there is a lot of pressure on ICC: Afridi on India-Bangladesh match
148.article_body: Talking about rain-curtailed India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 match, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi stated that there is a lot of pressure on ICC when India play. "Given the amount of rain that happened, the game resumed immediately after the break...India's pressure on ICC is evident," Afridi stated. "There are many factors involved," Afridi further said.

149.title: US embassy officials visit basketball player Griner in Russian prison
149.article_body: Officials from the US embassy in Moscow met detained US basketball player Brittney Griner on Thursday. The officials "saw firsthand her tenacity and perseverance despite her present circumstances", US State Department spokesman Ned Price said, adding that US would continue to push for her release. Last week, a Russian court rejected Griner's appeal of her nine-year sentence for drug possession.

150.title: Nuclear attack on US will result in end of Kim Jong-un's regime: US
150.article_body: After repeated missile launches by North Korea, US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said, "Any nuclear attack against the United States or its allies and partners, including the use of non-strategic nuclear weapons, is unacceptable." "It will result in the end of the Kim regime," he further said. North Korea launched over 20 missiles on Wednesday.

151.title: Are we thieves, murderers; don't we have engagements: Soren on ED summons
151.article_body: While speaking about the summons issued to him by the Enforcement Directorate, Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren asked, "Do you think we are 'chor-uchakke' (thieves) or 'hatyare' (murderers)? They issued the summons yesterday (Wednesday) and asked me to appear today (Thursday)." "Don't we have our engagements?" he further asked while saying that he was already invited to an event.

152.title: Twitter down for several users in India
152.article_body: Twitter was down for several users in India on Friday morning, with many reporting that they were unable to log into the website. A popup saying, "Something went wrong, but don't worry-try again", was shown to users trying to access the site. Notably, the outage was reported hours after news broke that Twitter will start laying off staff today.

153.title: Cong promises up to 300 units of free electricity ahead of Gujarat polls
153.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge announced 10 promises, including subsidised or free services in the health care, farm and electricity sectors. "LPG cylinders for ₹500, free electricity for up to 300 units, free treatment and medicines up to ₹10 lakh, loan waivers for up to ₹3 lakh for farmers," said Kharge.

154.title: Amazon pauses hiring in corporate workforce for the next few months
154.article_body: Amazon is pausing corporate workforce hiring as the e-commerce firm deals with an "unusual macro-economic environment", Beth Galetti, Senior Vice-president of People Experience and Technology, said. "We anticipate keeping this pause in place for the next few months...will continue to monitor what we're seeing in the economy and the business to adjust as we think makes sense," she added.

155.title: French Parliament suspended as MP shouts 'Go back to Africa' at black MP
155.article_body: France's lower house of Parliament was suspended on Thursday after a far-right MP shouted, "Go back to Africa!" as a Black legislator talked about immigration. Grégoire de Fournas later said his remark wasn't aimed at MP Carlos Bilongo but at migrants trying to reach Europe by sea. "There's no room for racism in our democracy," French PM Elisabeth Borne said.

156.title: 22,500-kg part of Chinese rocket, the size of 10-storey building, likely to crash on Earth
156.article_body: A 22,500-kg part of China's Long March 5B rocket is expected to crash on Earth either on Friday or Saturday, with uncertainty about where exactly it will land, according to the Aerospace Corporation. The part is said to be about the size of a 10-storey building. "The uncertainty of where the large debris will ultimately land presents...risk," it stated.

157.title: Woman, daughter among 3 dead as car falls into well in Maharashtra
157.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her eight-year-old daughter were among the three persons who died as their car fell into an old open well in Maharashtra's Buldhana, police said. The woman was driving and her husband and their daughter were with her, police added. He managed to come out safely and another man who tried to rescue them died, police stated.

158.title: Platform ticket prices reduced from ₹50 to ₹10 by Northern Railway
158.article_body: Northern Railway has rolled back the platform ticket prices that were increased to ₹50 due to Diwali and Chhath Puja. The platform ticket will now be available for ₹10, as before. "The rates of platform tickets at a total of 14 railway stations have been reduced…Tickets became cheaper at Lucknow, Varanasi, Barabanki, Ayodhya Cantt…Unnao," said the DCM of Northern Railway.

159.title: Ex-Andhra minister, son arrested for allegedly forging document
159.article_body: Former Andhra Pradesh minister and Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Ayyanna Patrudu and his son were arrested for allegedly forging a document, which was submitted to the High Court, related to encroachment of an irrigation canal land. Patrudu and his son were arrested from their residence in Narsipatnam. Patrudu's wife criticised the government for arresting the duo without prior information.

160.title: US-based Apiiro raises $100 mn in a round led by General Catalyst
160.article_body: US-based applications security startup Apiiro has secured $100 million in Series B funding round led by General Catalyst. The round saw participation from Greylock and Kleiner Perkins. The funding comes weeks after Globes reported that cybersecurity firm Palo Alto Networks was interested in buying Apiiro for around $550 million. In October 2020, Apiiro raised $35 million in Series A round.

161.title: Mumbai local train bumps into buffer while stopping at station, probe on
161.article_body: A local train in Mumbai bumped into a buffer while coming to halt at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) on Thursday. Reports said that no injury was reported in the incident. A Central Railway official said that an inquiry into the matter has been initiated to ascertain the exact cause of the incident.

162.title: Elon Musk removes 'Days of Rest' from Twitter employees' calendars: Reports
162.article_body: Elon Musk has removed 'Days of Rest' from Twitter employees' calendars for the rest of the year, as per reports. The monthly, company-wide day off was introduced at Twitter during the COVID-19 pandemic period to help reduce burnout. Meanwhile, Musk is reportedly planning to end the work from anywhere policy for Twitter staff who will not be affected by layoffs.

163.title: Balewadi residents launch campaign against Pune Smart City
163.article_body: A residency cooperative housing federation in Pune's Balewadi has launched a campaign against Pune Smart City Development Corporation Limited (PSCDCL) for being deprived of basic citizens' rights like water, roads, etc. "We're willing to hold a meeting with the residents...but we have...implemented projects such as...Balewadi road redesign...and LED street lights," PSCDCL CEO said.

164.title: Fire at warehouse in Pune as 10 LPG cylinders explode, no casualties
164.article_body: A major fire broke out at a private warehouse, full of plastic material and other scrap items, as about 10 LPG cylinders exploded in Vadgaonsheri's Sopan Nagar on the Pune-Ahmednagar Highway on Thursday. No casualties were reported in the incident. As many as 15 fire tenders along with eight fire officers and 60 firemen were rushed to the site.

165.title: India comments on Elon Musk's plan to charge $8/month for Twitter blue tick
165.article_body: Commenting on Elon Musk's plan to charge $8 per month for Twitter blue tick, Ministry of External Affairs' Official Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "We are not aware of the process of paid subscription." "We will take a decision based on the contours of this subscription service as and when it happens," he further said.

166.title: Twitter fired me after I made software to save emails, shared it with others: Engineer
166.article_body: A former Twitter engineer claimed that he was fired after he made a browser extension that helped download important emails and documents and shared it with his colleagues amid rumours about layoffs at the company. "My current understanding is...I was too much of a potential troublemaker for the new management," Emmanuel Cornet said speculating his reasons for being laid off.

167.title: Cheerios maker, Audi of America halt ads on Twitter after Musk takeover
167.article_body: After General Motors, Cheerios maker General Mills and luxury automaker Audi of America have paused advertising on Twitter following Tesla CEO Elon Musk taking over the social media company last week. "We will continue to monitor this new direction and evaluate our marketing spend," a General Mills spokesperson said. Audi of America said it would "continue to evaluate the situation".

168.title: 65% of Indian companies employed gig workers in 2022: Report
168.article_body: Almost 65% of Indian companies employed gig workers in 2022, a report by trade body NASSCOM, job portal Indeed and financial services firm AON showed. The report mentioned that share of companies (with more than 2,000 full-time employees) hiring gig workers has increased, but their proportion remains less than 5% of total workforce. In 2020, 57% companies employed gig workers.

169.title: Gangster Ejaz Lakdawala takes bottle of mosquitoes to Mumbai court to seek nets in jail
169.article_body: Gangster Ejaz Lakdawala, who is an undertrial at Taloja Central Jail, arrived at the Mumbai sessions court with a bottle filled with mosquitoes to seek access to mosquito nets. However, his plea was rejected as prison officials raised the issue of security, stating that nails and strings used for setting up the mosquito nets could pose safety concerns.

170.title: Cab driver beaten up in Delhi then left tied up in Gurugram; 4 held
170.article_body: Four people were arrested after a cab driver was allegedly beaten up and robbed in Delhi and then left tied up with a blindfold in Gurugram's Manesar. The accused had apparently hailed the victim's cab. "At Zakhira flyover, one of the accused got down on...pretext of urinating. The others tried to strangle...driver and pushed him in...back seat," an officer said.

171.title: 4.5 mn left without electricity after Russia's attacks: Ukraine Prez
171.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said about 4.5 million people have been temporarily left without electricity due to Russian attacks. "The very fact that Russia resorted to terror against the energy industry shows the weakness of the enemy. They cannot defeat Ukraine on the battlefield, and that's why they're trying to break our people in this way," he added.

172.title: Tiger Global halts new investments in Chinese equities: Report
172.article_body: Tiger Global Management has halted investments in Chinese equities even as it reassesses its exposure to the country after President Xi Jinping entered into his third term of power, The Wall Street Journal reported. The executives of the investment firm have reportedly said that geopolitical tensions could increase after Xi's re-election and China's zero-COVID-19 policy is likely to continue.

173.title: What will be affected as Delhi implements stage 4 of pollution action plan?
