173.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management has decided to implement measures under stage 4 of Graded Response Action Plan in Delhi-NCR. Under this, the entry of trucks other than electric and CNG, except those carrying essential commodities, will be banned. Four-wheeled diesel light motor vehicles, except BS-VI vehicles, will be banned. The construction work will also be restricted in Delhi-NCR.

174.title: 11 people killed as bus collides with car in Madhya Pradesh's Betul
174.article_body: As many as 11 people were killed in Madhya Pradesh's Betul after a bus collided with a car. The accident took place near the Jhallar police station. One person who was injured in the accident has been admitted to a hospital, SP Betul Simala Prasad told news agency ANI. A picture from accident site showed damaged car on the road.

175.title: Former Israel PM Netanyahu wins general election; PM Modi congratulates him
175.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday congratulated former Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu for his win in the general election. "Congratulations my friend Netanyahu on your success...I look forward to continuing our joint efforts to deepen the strategic partnership between India and Israel," PM Modi tweeted. This was Israel's fifth general election in less than four years.

176.title: 3 K'taka sisters enter lake to save their 14-yr-old brother, all 4 drown
176.article_body: Three sisters drowned while trying to save their 14-year-old brother from drowning in a lake in Vijayanagara district of Karnataka. The incident took place on Wednesday. The deceased have been identified as 17-year-old Ashwini, 14-year-old Abhishek, 19-year-old Kavya and 14-year-old Apoorva. Abhishek had fallen into the lake accidentally. His elder sister then jumped into the lake to save him.

177.title: Delhi's air quality 'severe' with 472 AQI; Noida's AQI at 562
177.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Friday morning was recorded as 'severe' with an air quality index (AQI) of 472. The AQI in Uttar Pradesh's Noida also stood in the 'severe' category at 562, while in Gurugram it stood at 539. An AQI of 563 was recorded on Friday morning near the Delhi University area.

178.title: Violence has no place in politics: US on Imran Khan assassination attempt
178.article_body: The US condemned the assassination attempt on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad. "Violence has no place in politics, and we call on all parties to refrain from violence...and intimidation," US State Secretary Antony Blinken said. The suspect who shot at Khan confessed that he wanted to "kill" the former premier "because he was misleading people".

179.title: If you are on your way to office, please go home: Twitter tells staff amid layoffs
179.article_body: Twitter will start laying off employees on Friday, a week after Elon Musk acquired the company. "If you are in an office or on your way to an office, please return home," Twitter wrote in an email to its staff. Employees who are being laid off will be notified with the next steps on their personal email accounts, Twitter said.

180.title: Layoffs to start on Friday: Twitter in email to staff
180.article_body: Twitter will alert employees on Friday about whether they will be laid off, the company said in an email to staff. The social media platform said in the email that its offices will be temporarily closed and all badge access will be suspended in order "to help ensure safety of each employee as well as Twitter systems and customer data".

181.title: 1-day old baby among 487 kids rescued under 'Operation Reunite' in Mumbai
181.article_body: The Mumbai Police have rescued 487 missing or abducted children in 45 days, from August 15 to September 30, under 'Operation Reunite'. Among those rescued are a one-day-old baby and a one-year-old girl. Out of the total, 257 girls and 230 boys have been rescued, Commissioner of Police (CP) Vivek Phansalkar, who had launched the operation, said.

182.title: Musk directs Twitter to cut infrastructure costs by $1 bn: Report
182.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has ordered teams at Twitter to find up to $1 billion in annual infrastructure cost savings, Reuters reported citing sources and an internal Slack message. The teams have a November 7 deadline to present their cost savings plans. Some employees have been ordered to work in the office throughout the week to meet the deadline.

183.title: Mumbai's Gokhale bridge declared unsafe, may be shut for traffic from Mon
183.article_body: Gopal Krishna Gokhale bridge in Mumbai's Andheri has been declared unsafe by a consultancy firm hired by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and may be shut for vehicular traffic from Monday. The firm said bridge's elements like RCC columns and girders have lost their strength due to corrosion. BMC has requested Mumbai Traffic Police to work on alternative route for motorists.

184.title: Couple fills pothole with soil on B'luru road after 'narrowly escaping death'
184.article_body: A couple filled up a pothole with soil after they apparently 'narrowly escaped death' in Bengaluru's Malleshwaram, a Twitter handle that shared the clip of the incident claimed. "This is [the] state of #NammaBengaluru roads...wake up," the tweet by @SpeakUpBengalur, which tagged BBMP Commissioner and CM Basavaraj Bommai, read. At least three people died due to potholes in Bengaluru recently.

185.title: Will solve problems faced by offices on Bengaluru's ORR: Minister
185.article_body: Bengaluru's civic body will hold a meeting on November 14 and examine the situation of the Outer Ring Road, minister CN Ashwath Narayan has said. The assurance came after the civic body received complaints from companies that have office spaces on Outer Ring Road and from residents who live there. Narayan also said service roads in Bengaluru will be upgraded.

186.title: Gerard Piqué announces retirement from football after 14 years with Barcelona
186.article_body: Spanish defender Gerard Piqué has announced his retirement from football after 14 years with Barcelona. Sharing a video on social media, Piqué stated that Barcelona's La Liga match against Almería on Saturday will be the last match of his career. The 35-year-old has played 615 matches for Barcelona, winning eight La Liga titles and three Champions League titles.

187.title: Schools in Noida & Greater Noida to hold online classes till Nov 8 amid pollution
187.article_body: Schools in Noida and Greater Noida will hold online classes for students of Classes 1-8 till November 8 in view of rising pollution in Delhi-NCR, as per an official order. Schools have also been told to hold online classes for students of Classes 9-12 "as far as possible". All outdoor activities in schools are also banned until further orders.

188.title: Don't look at fake fielding as reason for not reaching target: Harsha to Bangladesh fans
188.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle, in a message to Bangladesh fans, said, "Please don't look at fake fielding or wet conditions as a reason for not reaching the target." He added, "If one of the batters had stayed till the end, Bangladesh could have won it. We are all guilty of it...when we search for excuses, we don't grow."

189.title: India abstains from Russia-sponsored draft resolution at UNSC
189.article_body: India has abstained from voting at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) on a resolution sponsored by Russia to investigate alleged "military biological activities" being carried out by Ukraine. The resolution failed to get adopted as the US, the UK and France voted against it. Only, Russia and China voted in support.

190.title: Freshworks faces class action lawsuits over 'false' IPO papers
190.article_body: Nasdaq-listed Freshworks is facing class action lawsuits over false and misleading offering papers filed by the company ahead of its IPO. Law firms alleged that Freshworks didn't state that it encountered obstacles at the time of the offering. Freshworks offered 28.5 million shares at $36 per share to raise over $1 billion at a valuation of nearly $10 billion.

191.title: India, UK working sincerely on free trade agreement: MEA
191.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said it is working "sincerely" with the UK government for finalisation of the proposed free trade agreement. "Both sides are working sincerely on the free trade agreement," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. This comes days after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his British counterpart Rishi Sunak agreed on "early conclusion" of the deal.

192.title: Heavy rains inundate several areas in Puducherry
192.article_body: Heavy rains inundated several areas and almost all thoroughfares in Puducherry on Thursday. On the day, Puducherry, including suburban areas, received 5 cm of rain till 4.30 pm. CM N Rangasamy chaired an emergency meeting to take stock of relief and rehabilitation works. Later, Rangasamy told reporters "all necessary steps have been taken to ensure that people face no hardship".

193.title: Rajeev reacts to cheating allegations by Charu, accuses her of 'romance with Karan Mehra'
193.article_body: After Charu Asopa accused actor Rajeev Sen of cheating on her, Rajeev said, "She has no proof...her ego has gone out of the roof." Talking about voice notes sent to him by Charu's mother, Rajeev said, "One of the points to be noted from...voice note is her romance with...actor Karan Mehra." "She has major trust issues, not me," he added.

194.title: Activist refuses to speak to journalist for not wearing bindi in Maha, video surfaces
194.article_body: Maharashtra activist Sambhaji Bhide refused to speak to a journalist as she wasn't wearing a bindi. The incident was caught on camera and the clip of the television channel went viral. "Every woman is like Bharat Mata and Bharat Mata is not widow," Sambhaji Bhide said to the journalist.  The state women's commission has served a notice to Sambhaji.

195.title: I respect Bibi Jagir Kaur a lot: SAD chief after party suspends her
195.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Thursday said that he and his father, ex-Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal, respect Bibi Jagir Kaur a lot. "I can say that I never said no to Bibi ji for anything," the chief added. This comes after SAD suspended Kaur from the primary membership of the party over alleged anti-party activities.

196.title: Terrorist gunned down along LoC in J&K's Poonch: Army
196.article_body: The Army gunned down a terrorist in Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday, foiling an infiltration bid along the Line of Control (LoC), officials said. The security personnel challenged the terrorists after noticing suspicious movements along the LoC. A pistol, two AK-47 rifles, and war-like stores were recovered, an Army spokesperson said.

197.title: Lyft to lay off 13% of its workforce in second round of job cuts
197.article_body: Lyft said that it will lay off 13% of its workforce in its second round of job cuts. The ride-hailing company froze hiring in US in September as a cost cutting measure and also laid off about 60 workers earlier this year. "The announced reduction in force is a proactive step as part of the company's annual planning," Lyft said.

198.title: 8 ex-Navy officers detained in Qatar, trying to secure their early release: MEA
198.article_body: The MEA said on Thursday that the Indian embassy in Doha is making efforts to secure the early release and repatriation of eight ex-Navy officers who've been detained there. The concerned persons were reportedly working for a private company in Qatar. "The detained persons have also spoken to their family members on a few occasions," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said.

199.title: Cholera spreading 'rapidly' in Lebanon: WHO
199.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) said cholera is spreading "rapidly" in Lebanon. The disease has spread to all parts of the country with around 1,400 suspected cases presently, according to the WHO. WHO Regional Emergency Director Rick Brennan said the disease may have come from neighbouring Syria. The first cholera case reported in Lebanon was in 1993.

200.title: Leave Iran immediately: German government to its citizens
200.article_body: The German Ministry of Foreign Affairs has asked all its citizens to immediately leave Iran, saying there is a "concrete danger of being arbitrarily arrested, interrogated and sentenced to long prison terms". The ministry added that dual nationals with German and Iranian citizenship are also at risk. The notice comes as the Iranian government is trying to control women-led protests.

201.title: Vodafone Idea's Q2 loss widens to ₹7,595.5 cr over subscriber loss
201.article_body: Telecom operator Vodafone Idea's net consolidated loss widened to ₹7,595.5 crore in the second quarter ended September. The company had posted a loss of ₹7,132.3 crore in the same period a year ago. Vodafone Idea's subscriber base declined to 23.44 crore in the September quarter compared to 24 crore in the previous quarter.

202.title: Vajpayee & PM Modi gave importance to HP like no one else: Rajnath
202.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said only two prime ministers, ex-PM Atal Bihari Vajpayee and PM Narendra Modi, have given "importance to Himachal Pradesh like nobody else". "People of [India] can evaluate...what earlier governments did and what present government is doing," Singh said at a meeting in Solan. Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh will be held on November 12.

203.title: Turkey's annual inflation climbs to 24-year high of 85.5%
203.article_body: Turkey's annual inflation hit its 24-year high of 85.51% in October this year, according to official data on Thursday. The country has recorded severe inflation since last year, when the lira also fell in value. According to reports, the economic situation is a fallout of the central bank cutting its policy rate.

204.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
204.article_body: The IMD issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs for next few days. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Kerala and Tamil Nadu from November 4 to 7 and over Puducherry from November 5 to 7. It's very likely over Jammu and Kashmir on November 6 and over Andaman and Nicobar Islands on November 7.

205.title: EAM S Jaishankar to visit Moscow on November 7 & 8
205.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will visit Moscow, Russia on November 7 and 8, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Thursday. During his visit, Jaishankar is expected to hold meetings with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov and Deputy Prime Minister of Trade and Industry Denis Manturov. Talks on economic cooperation are set to feature prominently during the meetings.

206.title: Odisha Assembly’s winter session to start from November 24
206.article_body: The Odisha Assembly's winter session will start on November 24 and end on December 31, according to a statement issued by the Assembly Secretariat. There will be 33 working days in the session and five 'no meeting' days. On November 24, the first supplementary expenditure statement for the year 2022-23 is expected to be presented in the House.

207.title: Ratan Tata-owned Electra EV raises $25 mn from GEF Capital
207.article_body: Ratan Tata-owned Electrodrive Powertrain Solutions Ltd, or Electra EV raised $25 million from GEF Capital Partners' South Asia Growth Fund II for a minority stake in the EV startup. The EV startup has a manufacturing plant in Coimbatore and an R&D centre in Pune. Electra's powertrain solutions have been installed in Tata Xpres-T (fleet) and Tata Ace EV.

208.title: Not receiving instructions from my client, discharge me from case: Mallya's lawyer to SC
208.article_body: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya's lawyer EC Agrawala has urged Supreme Court to relieve him from Mallya's case, saying, "I'm not receiving any instructions from this man." He added, "Mallya has been incommunicado for a long time." The court asked him to provide Mallya’s email and residential address in UK to the court registry and allowed him to initiate discharge proceedings.

209.title: How does the points table of India's group in T20 WC read after Pakistan's 2nd win?
209.article_body: Pakistan on Thursday registered their second victory in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. India are on top of Group 2 points table with six points. They are followed by South Africa (five points) and Pakistan (four points). Netherlands are placed last and are out of the semi-finals race, having accumulated two points in four matches.

210.title: Pakistan's Nawaz doesn't take DRS for LBW thinking he is run out, video goes viral
210.article_body: Pakistan's Muhammad Nawaz didn't take DRS for LBW despite his bat touching ball and walked off after being run out on the same delivery against South Africa. A video of the same has gone viral. Nawaz would've been not out had he reviewed the decision as the umpire had declared him LBW out, which would have been overturned by DRS.

211.title: You're sometimes taken lightly in a male-dominated industry: Sargun
211.article_body: Actress-producer Sargun Mehta has said, "As a woman working in an industry that's predominantly ruled by men, sometimes you're taken lightly." However, she added that she tries and sees the good thing in it. Sargun stated that people thought they could take her for a ride by assuming that she did not know anything, but, she "knew a little more".

212.title: Kerala court orders 'Kantara' makers to stop playing 'Varaha...' in theatres, OTT
212.article_body: Palakkad District Court has issued an ad-interim injunction, directing the makers of 'Kantara' to stop playing the song 'Varaha Roopam' in theatres and OTT platforms. This comes after Kerala-based band Thaikkudam Bridge accused 'Kantara' makers of copying 'Varaha Roopam' from their song 'Navarasam'. Mathrubhumi Printing and Publishing Company Ltd filed a copyright infringement suit against makers.

213.title: Vote for AAP, will take you to Ayodhya temple: Kejriwal to Guj people
213.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday shared a video message on Twitter in Gujarati. "I'll build you schools and hospitals, give you free electricity...take you to the Ram Temple in Ayodhya...Give me one chance," he said. Voting for the Gujarat Assembly elections will take place on December 1 and December 5.

214.title: Video shows Raj minister asking bureaucrat to 'get out' of meeting
214.article_body: A video has surfaced showing Rajasthan Health Minister Parsadi Lal Meena asking a Zila Parishad CEO to leave a meeting which was being held at Dausa collectorate. The minister reportedly asked the bureaucrat to "get out" after the latter gave him 'unsatisfactory' response regarding the approval of MLA funds. The video showed the CEO leaving the meeting with his files.

215.title: Microsoft extends free tech support for Ukraine through 2023
215.article_body: Microsoft will extend technology support free of charge for Ukraine throughout 2023, the company announced. Microsoft said it would provide additional technology aid of nearly $100 million, bringing its total support for the war-hit country to over $400 million since the crisis began in February. Earlier in June, Microsoft said it was making substantial cuts to its business in Russia.

216.title: Chitra Wagh appointed as President of Maharashtra BJP women's wing
216.article_body: Maharashtra BJP President Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Thursday appointed Chitra Wagh as the President of the Maharashtra Pradesh Mahila Morcha, the women's wing of the party. After taking over from her predecessor Uma Khapre, Wagh tweeted and thanked Bawankule and Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis for giving her the responsibility. Before joining the BJP, Wagh was incharge of the NCP's women's wing.

217.title: Kejriwal refused to use bio-decomposer in Punjab: Bhupender Yadav
217.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal had "officially refused" to use the Pusa bio-decomposer in Punjab to curb stubble burning. The Pusa bio-decomposer can turn paddy straw into manure in 15-20 days. Yadav added that no Delhi government representative participated in National Conference of Environment Ministers in Gujarat in September.

218.title: K'taka govt withdraws tender reserving job of managing slippers for SCs, STs
218.article_body: Karnataka government's Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Department on Wednesday issued a tender reserving job of managing slippers at temples for people from Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Scheduled Tribes (STs). It was withdrawn on the same day citing "technical reasons". It invited other works like supply of tender coconut too but only kept job of managing slippers reserved.

219.title: Video shows the moment of firing at Imran Khan's Pakistan rally
219.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan was shot in the leg on Thursday at a political rally in Wazirabad. A video of the incident showed Khan and his supporters ducking on top of a lorry. Multiple gunshots, including from an automatic rifle, are heard as the crowd panics. Khan was taken to a hospital in Lahore after he sustained injury.

220.title: Mamata plays drums at WB Guv's function in Chennai, video surfaces
220.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday took to playing drums at state Governor La Ganesan's family function in Chennai, a video of which has surfaced online. Banerjee was attending the 80th birthday celebrations of Ganesan's brother. Notably, Banerjee also paid a courtesy call to Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, stating that she couldn't leave without meeting him.

221.title: Leave Iran or risk arrest, long prison terms: Germany to its nationals
221.article_body: Germany on Thursday urged its citizens to leave Iran or risk arrest and long prison terms there. "Dual nationals who have Iranian as well as German citizenship are at risk," a statement by Germany's foreign ministry read. The statement comes amid widespread protests in Iran since the custodial death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was imprisoned for wearing 'improper hijab'.

222.title: Ensure security at Kejriwal's house: Delhi HC to police after vandalism row
222.article_body: The Delhi HC has directed city police to ensure that security measures are undertaken to guard CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence. The direction came in response to a PIL by AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj which sought formation of an SIT to probe vandalism that broke out outside Kejriwal's house in March. Some people had protested against Kejriwal's remarks on 'The Kashmir Files'.

223.title: Janhvi Kapoor and her family buy duplex apartment for ₹65 crore in Mumbai
223.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor and her family have bought a duplex apartment in Mumbai's Bandra West area for ₹65 crore, documents accessed by Indextap.com showed. The apartment, with a carpet area of 6,421 sq ft, is located on the first and second floors of a building. The property has been jointly bought by Janhvi, her father Boney Kapoor and sister Khushi Kapoor.

224.title: I wish that I had a bigger role in 'Vikram Vedha': Radhika Apte
224.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte, speaking about why she did 'Vikram Vedha' despite her role being small, has said that she wanted to work with directors Pushkar and Gayatri. "I've rejected many films that had my role at the centre but I did not like the script...but I did wish...I had a bigger role in 'Vikram Vedha'," she added.

225.title: Elon Musk to restore Twitter content-moderation tools: Report
225.article_body: Twitter's new owner, Elon Musk reportedly said that he will restore the content-moderation tools, blocked for some staff, by the end of the week. Last week, Twitter limited the number of staff that have access to the social media platform's tool dashboard to enforce policy actions, Bloomberg reported. Musk made the promise to civil rights leaders over a Zoom meeting.

226.title: Stripe to lay off 14% of workforce, CEO says 'overhired for the world we're in'
226.article_body: Electronic payments company Stripe on Thursday announced that it's laying off 14% of its workforce, impacting around 1,120 of its 8,000 employees. In a memo, CEO Patrick Collison wrote, "We overhired for the world we're in, and it pains us to be unable to deliver the experience." The layoffs come months after Stripe reportedly cut its internal valuation by 28%.

227.title: Bank of England increases interest rates by 0.75%, biggest hike in 33 years
227.article_body: The Bank of England raised interest rates by 75 basis points to 3%, its largest single hike in 33 years. The move was announced after consumer price inflation returned to a 40-year high in September. It comes after the US Federal Reserve announced a fourth consecutive three-quarter point jump on Wednesday to combat growing inflation.

228.title: Amber Heard deletes Twitter account days after ex-boyfriend Elon Musk's takeover: Reports
228.article_body: Days after Elon Musk acquired Twitter, actress Amber Heard's account has disappeared. The disappearance of Heard's account was first noticed by YouTuber Matthew Lewis, who tweeted, "Amber Heard has deleted her Twitter." It's unclear when or why Heard removed her account, or the reasons surrounding the deactivation. Heard was reportedly in a relationship with Musk between 2016 and 2018.

229.title: Janhvi started dieting at 13, scolded her for ordering grilled fish with no butter: Boney
229.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor has revealed that his daughter Janhvi started dieting when she was 13. "I scolded Janhvi...when...[she] ordered a grilled fish with no butter...I was like, 'What's the fun of having fish without butter?'" Boney said. "I used to be stressed while going out with Janhvi as she used to select...restaurant where she'll get her diet food," he added.

230.title: BJP will definitely win Gujarat Assembly polls: Union minister Sonowal
230.article_body: Union minister and BJP leader Sarbananda Sonowal said his party will definitely win the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. "Under the leadership of PM Modi, the work that has happened in Gujarat has become a model of development for the whole country," Sonowal said. His comment comes after the Election Commission of India (ECI) announced the schedule for the state election.

231.title: Omar won't contest polls if J&K's statehood not restored: Farooq
231.article_body: Former CM Omar Abdullah will not contest Assembly elections till statehood is restored to Jammu and Kashmir, his father and National Conference President Farooq Abdullah said on Thursday. The MP also dismissed suggestions that the party's constituency in-charges would get the party mandate for the elections. "No one is the MLA candidate. We will have talks about coalitions," he added.

232.title: Delhi govt extends last date to apply for power subsidy to November 15
232.article_body: The Delhi government on Thursday extended the last date to apply for power subsidy to November 15. Earlier, the last date to submit the application online or offline was October 31 and over 34 lakh of around 57 lakh consumers had applied for the subsidy by then. The government will provide subsidy to only those consumers who apply for it.

233.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Ram Setu' domestically collects ₹58.90 crore
233.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Jacqueline Fernandez's 'Ram Setu' has collected ₹58.90 crore across India since its release on October 25. The film, which also starred Nushrratt Bharuccha, had collected ₹15.25 crore on its opening day. Akshay's 'Ram Setu' released on Diwali along with 'Thank God', which featured Sidharth Malhotra and Ajay Devgn.

234.title: EC must explain separate poll dates for Himachal, Gujarat: Cong
234.article_body: Congress asked the Election Commission to explain why elections in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh were announced for separate dates when counting of votes will be on the same day. Congress's Gujarat in-charge Raghu Sharma said the party is working hard in Gujarat and results will be "surprising". Gujarat will go to polls in two phases on December 1 and 5.

235.title: Centre seeks report on Satyendar Jain's 'special treatment' in Tihar jail
235.article_body: The MHA has sought a report from Delhi's Chief Secretary on allegations that Tihar jail officials are rendering "special treatment" to AAP's Satyendar Jain. This comes after purported footage of Jain receiving body massage inside his cell was submitted by Enforcement Directorate (ED) to a special court. The ED also said that Jain was provided with salads in his cell.

236.title: Protestors from Punjab, AAP workers clash during Kejriwal's speech in Himachal
236.article_body: Protestors from Punjab, who are members of Punjab ETT Teachers Association, clashed with AAP workers during Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal's speech at a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh's Solan. Protestors raised slogans against AAP and Punjab government, forcing Kejriwal to cut short his speech. "If you (protestors) want this 'gundagardi' (hooliganism), you should go to BJP," Kejriwal said.

237.title: Hero MotoCorp reports 10% fall in net profit at ₹716 crore in Q2
237.article_body: Hero MotoCorp posted a 9.9% year-on-year decrease in standalone net profit at ₹716 crore for the quarter ended September. Revenue from operations grew by 7.4% from ₹8,453.40 crore in the same quarter last fiscal to ₹9,075.35 crore in Q2. Company's total sales saw a 17% fall at 4,54,582 units in October 2022 as compared with 5,47,970 units in October 2021.

238.title: Projects worth ₹2 lakh cr approved for Maharashtra: PM Modi
238.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the Centre has approved projects worth ₹2 lakh crore for Maharashtra. PM Modi's announcement comes as the Shinde-Fadnavis government faces flak from the Opposition for losing out proposed big-ticket projects to poll-bound Gujarat. He said that ₹75,000 crore worth of railway projects and ₹50,000 crore worth of projects for modern roads were approved.

239.title: Man tears, burns pages of Quran at mosque in UP; arrested
239.article_body: A man has been arrested for allegedly tearing and burning few pages of holy book Quran at a mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur on Wednesday. Police said a CCTV footage revealed that Taj Mohammad secretly entered the mosque, damaged the book and escaped without being noticed by anyone. Some locals engaged in arson while protesting against the crime.

240.title: Global Health IPO subscribed 26% on first day of offering
240.article_body: Global Health, which operates the Medanta brand of hospitals, launched its maiden public offering, receiving 26% subscription on the first day. The IPO attracted bids for 1,19,50,268 shares against 4,67,42,397 shares on offer, according to data from NSE. The IPO has a fresh issue of up to ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of up to 5,07,61,000 equity shares.

241.title: K'taka MLA Renukacharya's nephew found dead in car days after he went missing
241.article_body: Karnataka BJP MLA M P Renukacharya's nephew Chandrashekar, who was missing since Sunday, was found dead inside a car that had fallen into a canal. The car was found near Kadadakatte in Honnali taluk of Davanagere district on Thursday. The MLA earlier said that he suspected that Chandrashekar might have been kidnapped as his father is a contractor.

242.title: Bollywood actress is lot more than being size zero: Double XL's Huma
242.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, who features in 'Double XL', was asked to give a message to girls who feel that being size zero is the way to enter the film industry. "Not at all...It is your talent and hard work. If you want to be a Hindi film actress, there is a lot more than being just size zero," Huma stated.

243.title: Woman dies by suicide over irregularities in kitty party fund in MP
243.article_body: A 33-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide in Madhya Pradesh's Indore over alleged irregularities in a kitty party fund, police have said. In a note, she has blamed some people for troubling her over a kitty party fund dispute. Her husband has said that the alleged dispute is worth several lakh rupees, police said.

244.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif seeks immediate report on attack on Imran Khan
244.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has sought an immediate report on the attack on former Pakistan PM and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) chief Imran Khan. Taking to Twitter Sharif said, "I pray for the recovery and health of PTI chairman Khan...Violence should have no place in our country's politics." Khan was shot in his leg during his rally in Wazirabad on Thursday.

245.title: Drugs worth ₹79 lakh seized in Surat, Mumbai-based drug peddler held
245.article_body: The Surat Police arrested a Mumbai-based drug peddler and seized 792 grams of mephedrone drug worth ₹79.28 lakh along with ₹1,100 cash and two mobile phones on Wednesday. The peddler was identified as 35-year-old Mohammed Ahmed alias Monu, a resident of Mumbai's Dharavi. Based on tip-off, police intercepted a youth walking with travel bag, in which the drugs were found.

246.title: HPCL reports net loss of ₹2,172 cr in Q2, revenue falls by 5.3%
246.article_body: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation (HPCL) reported a standalone net loss of ₹2,172 crore for the quarter ended September 2022. The company had registered a profit of ₹1,923 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. During the quarter, the company’s revenue declined 5.3% sequentially to ₹1.08 lakh crore from ₹1.14 lakh crore in the June quarter.

247.title: Harvey Weinstein masturbated in front of me, grabbed my breasts: Massage therapist
247.article_body: A licensed massage therapist recounted her ordeal in court and alleged that Harvey Weinstein masturbated in front of her during business appointments. She added that while he was masturbating, he put his other hand underneath her tank top and grabbed her breasts, adding that it left a red mark on her chest. "He just kept yelling at me," she said.

248.title: Wipro appoints former Capgemini executive Amit Choudhary as COO
248.article_body: IT firm Wipro has appointed former Capgemini executive Amit Choudhary as Chief Operating Officer (COO) and member of the company's executive board. The position remained vacant after former COO Bhanumurthy Ballapuram retired in July 2021. Choudhary will be responsible for improving organisational operational efficiency and helping drive sustainable growth, Wipro said.

249.title: Twitter notifications aren't working: US Congresswoman after blue tick row
249.article_body: US Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (AOC) on Wednesday said her Twitter "mentions/notifications conveniently aren't working". "Just a reminder that money will never buy your way out of insecurity, folks," AOC tweeted. After Twitter CEO Elon Musk had announced his plan to charge $8/month for the blue checkmark, AOC had said, "Lmao at a billionaire...[selling] 'free speech'...[for] $8/month."

250.title: Unknown woman appeared naked in WhatsApp video call, alleges K'taka BJP MLA
250.article_body: Karnataka BJP MLA GH Thippareddy has filed a police complaint over a possible attempt by unknown persons to trap him in a sex video. The MLA stated in his complaint that on October 31, he received a WhatsApp video call in which an unknown woman appeared naked. The caller shared a vulgar video after he disconnected, he alleged.

251.title: Australia offers ₹5.2-cr reward for info on Indian man who allegedly killed woman on beach
251.article_body: The Australian police on Thursday announced AU$1 million (₹5.2 crore) reward for any information on an Indian male nurse named Rajwinder Singh who allegedly killed a 24-year-old woman on a beach in Queensland in 2018. Rajwinder, who is the key person of interest in the case, had escaped from Australia two days after the woman was killed.

252.title: I'd sound good singing with Rihanna, Billie Eilish, Sia: Aditya Narayan
252.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan said there are a few international artists that he would like to collaborate with. "Rihanna is one of my favourite artists, Sia, Billie Eilish, and Dua Lipa, I think I'd sound good singing with these talented ladies that I am a huge, huge fan of," he further added. Aditya voiced the Hindi version of 'Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile'.

253.title: 8i Ventures marks first close of second fund at $25 mn
253.article_body: Venture capital firm 8i Ventures marked the first close of its second fund at $25 million after getting investments from family offices like Salgaocars and Kothari (DSP). The fund, launched in December last year, expects to mark the final close of the $50-million fund by March 2023. 8i Ventures was founded in 2019 by Vikram Chachra and Vishwanath V.

254.title: IMD issues 'orange alert' for three districts in Kerala
254.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued an 'orange alert' for three districts in southern Kerala. Kottayam, Pathanamthitta and Idukki are likely to witness very heavy rainfall on Friday, according to a statement. Northeast monsoon has been active over Kerala and rain or thundershower is likely for the next five days due to a cyclonic circulation over south Tamil Nadu.

255.title: Yes Bank to close stressed asset sale to JC Flowers ARC this month: CEO
255.article_body: Yes Bank CEO and Managing Director Prashant Kumar said that the company is expecting to close its stressed asset sale of over ₹48,000 crore to JC Flowers ARC by the end of November. JC Flowers has committed to pay ₹11,183 crore for the entire pool of the stressed loans, which assures a 23% recovery to the bank.

256.title: CM Kejriwal's negligence fatal for people: Manoj Tiwari on air pollution
256.article_body: As Delhi's AQI crossed 400-mark to remain in 'severe' category, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari on Thursday criticised CM Arvind Kejriwal and said his negligence is fatal for the people of the national capital.  "He installed...smog tower just to show the media and today that too is closed," he added. Kejriwal claims that each smog tower costs ₹2 crore, Tiwari added.

257.title: MoS Home's convoy allegedly attacked in Bengal's Cooch Behar
257.article_body: Union Minister of State (MoS) for Home Nisith Pramanik alleged that his convoy was attacked in West Bengal's Cooch Behar district on Thursday. However, police said it was a "minor scuffle" as some people tried to wave black flags at him. Pramanik said BJP workers won't sit quietly if their minister is attacked in front of them.

258.title: Actor-politician Shashi Kumar, ex-Cong MP & others join BJP in K'taka
258.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Shashi Kumar, former Congress MP SP Muddahanumegowda and retired IAS officer BH Anil Kumar joined the BJP in poll-bound Karnataka on Thursday in the presence of CM Basavaraj Bommai. Congress Seva Dal state Vice-President Hanumantrao Javali, Samajwadi Party leader HY Ravikumar and former Delhi CM Sheila Dikshit’s special officer Ramesh Muniyappa also joined the ruling party.

259.title: Terrorists open fire upon 2 migrant labourers working at school in J&K
259.article_body: Terrorists opened fire at two migrant labourers, one from Bihar and another from Nepal, working at a private school in Bondialgam area of Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag on Thursday evening. Both labourers have been shifted to the hospital, Kashmir Zone Police said. While one labourer has reportedly suffered a head injury, the other has been injured in his abdomen.

260.title: Sandalwood tree stolen from Odisha Raj Bhavan in Bhubaneswar
260.article_body: A sandalwood tree has been allegedly stolen from the high-security premises of Odisha Raj Bhavan in Bhubaneswar, police said. The tree was cut on Tuesday and the Raj Bhavan filed a complaint. CCTV camera footage of the area is being checked, police said, adding that no arrests have been made so far.

261.title: Boney shares old pic with Sridevi, Janhvi; says 'I'm Janhvi's biggest fan'
261.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor took to Instagram and shared an old picture with his late wife Sridevi and daughter Janhvi Kapoor. Along with the picture, Boney wrote, "I felt like the king of the world when meri Janhvi mujhe 'mili' [my Janhvi met me]...I'm easily her biggest fan!" He added that he knew Janhvi would make him proud.

262.title: No matter how powerful the corrupt may be, they shouldn't be saved: PM
262.article_body: Addressing an event marking Vigilance Awareness Week of the Central Vigilance Commission, PM Narendra Modi on Thursday called for "zero tolerance" against corruption. He said, "No matter how powerful the corrupt may be, they should not be saved under any circumstances." "No corrupt person should get political-social support, every corrupt person should be put in...dock by the society," he added.

263.title: UCO Bank's Q2 net profit surges by 145% to ₹504 crore
263.article_body: UCO Bank on Thursday reported a 145% rise in its net profit to ₹504.52 crore in the July-September quarter, as against ₹205.4 crore in the year-ago period. Total revenue of the Kolkata-headquartered lender in the quarter rose to ₹4,964.84 crore from ₹4,655.86 crore in the year-ago quarter. Interest income during Q2 rose to ₹4,184.89 crore from ₹3,719.79 crore.

264.title: 6 men trapped in Cambodia on pretext of IT jobs rescued by TN govt
264.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has rescued six men who were trapped in Cambodia on the pretext of jobs in the IT sector. The men have reportedly been brought back to India and sent back to their respective hometowns. "People who look for jobs abroad from Tamil Nadu are [often] misguided by fake agents," state Minorities Welfare Minister Gingee KS Masthan said.

265.title: Student punished for raising 'Bharat Mata ki Jai' slogan in MP school
265.article_body: Two teachers were booked for allegedly punishing a student for raising "Bharat Mata ki Jai" slogan after assembly at Christ Senior Secondary School in Madhya Pradesh's Guna. The incident came to light on Thursday after parents staged a protest outside the school. The principal of the school, however, said that the student chanted the slogan as a joke, not patriotism.

266.title: My father never wanted me to get married: Jaya Bachchan
266.article_body: Jaya Bachchan has revealed that her father never wanted her to get married. After Amitabh Bachchan proposed to her for marriage, Jaya's father told her that he hasn't brought her into this world to just educate herself, get married and have children. Amitabh convinced him by saying, "My parents are alive. I want them to attend [the wedding]", she revealed.

267.title: 5 smartphones seized from high-security zone in Punjab's Sangrur jail
267.article_body: The police recovered five smartphones from gangsters during a raid from the high-security zone in Punjab's Sangrur jail on Thursday morning, the police said. Sim cards were installed in four smartphones, while one smartphone was without a sim card. The raid was led by SP Palvinder Singh Cheema and included five DSPs, seven SHOs and over 100 policemen.

268.title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif condemns attack on Imran Khan, seeks report
268.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif has 'severely condemned' the attack on former Pakistan PM Imran Khan. He also sought an immediate report on the incident from top police and government officials, Pak newspaper Dawn reported. Reportedly, Khan was shot in his leg in firing during his rally in Pakistan's Wazirabad on Thursday. The firing was reported near the container of Khan.

269.title: 55-yr-old woman mauled to death by tiger in Maha's Chandrapur
269.article_body: A 55-year-old woman, Jaibai Tondare, was mauled to death by a tiger on Thursday in Brahmapuri in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district, a forest official said. The incident took place in the afternoon when the woman was engaged in farm work. The family of the deceased has been given ₹20,000 as initial compensation, Chief Conservator of Forests Prakash Lonkar said.

270.title: JMM workers hold protest rally in Ranchi against ED summons to Soren
270.article_body: JMM workers on Thursday took out a rally in Ranchi to protest against Enforcement Directorate's summons to CM Hemant Soren for questioning in a money laundering probe. JMM workers shouted slogans against BJP and marched to the CM's residence where Soren addressed them. He claimed the summons was a part of a conspiracy hatched by BJP to destabilise his government.

271.title: Air quality panel bans diesel LMVs in Delhi-NCR, asks states to decide on school closure
271.article_body: Centre's air quality panel has asked states to decide on closure of schools, non-emergency commercial activities and implementing odd-even scheme for vehicles amid rising pollution in Delhi-NCR. The panel has banned plying of diesel LMVs in Delhi-NCR. BS-VI, essential and emergency services vehicles will be exempted. It has ordered closure of industries that aren't running on clean fuels in NCR.

272.title: Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' collects over ₹500 crore globally
272.article_body: Mani Ratnam's directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' has collected over ₹500 crore at the box office globally. The film, which features Vikram and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan, collected close to ₹335 crore across India. 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', which released on September 30, collected around ₹230 crore in the state of Tamil Nadu. The second instalment of the film will release in 2023.

273.title: K'taka woman gives birth to twins at home after hospital shuns her, all die
273.article_body: A 30-year-old woman and her newborn twins died in Karnataka's Tumakuru on Thursday after the district hospital refused to admit her for delivery there. The deceased woman, identified as Kasturi, gave birth to her twin boys at her residence, shortly after which she died due to profuse bleeding. Locals have reportedly sought the suspension of the concerned doctors and staff.

274.title: Meta India head Ajit Mohan quits with immediate effect
274.article_body: Meta India country head Ajit Mohan has stepped down from the company with immediate effect, Nicola Mendelsohn, Vice President, Global Business Group, Meta said in a statement. Ajit had joined Meta as the Managing Director for the India market in January 2019. As per reports, Ajit will join Snap, where he will serve as the President of the APAC business.

275.title: Lashkar-e-Taiba associate arrested in Pulwama, grenade recovered
275.article_body: Police arrested a militant associate of terrorist outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) during a surprise check in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama on Thursday. The associate has been identified as Zubair Ahmad Dar, a resident of Pulwama. Police said Zubair was tasked to carry out attacks on security forces and non-local labourers in the area. A hand grenade was recovered from his possession.

276.title: Cognizant's Q3 profit rises by 15.6% YoY to $629 mn, revenue up by 2.4%
276.article_body: IT services company Cognizant reported a 15.6% increase in net profit to $629 million for the third quarter as against $544 million in the year-ago period. Cognizant's revenue for the Q3 grew 2.4% year-over-year to about $4.9 billion. The New Jersey-based firm revised its revenue growth guidance in constant currency terms for the full year to 7% from 8.5-9.5%.

277.title: Ex-Miss Barbados claims Miss World 2000 was 'rigged' to favour Priyanka
277.article_body: A YouTuber and former Miss Barbados 2000 alleged that the Miss World pageant of 2000, which Priyanka Chopra won, was "rigged". Leilani McConney said the show was sponsored by ZeeTV, an Indian cable station, and alleged that Priyanka was 'favoured'. Leilani claimed in her video that Priyanka's gowns were better made and she was even allowed food in her room.

278.title: Lawyer carries gun into courtroom during case hearing in Bihar, arrested
278.article_body: A lawyer was arrested in Bihar's Muzaffarpur district for allegedly carrying a gun to the court during the hearing of a case, police said on Thursday. "The judge...asked his security guards to take the weapon from the possession of the advocate, and ordered his...arrest," a police officer said. The arrested lawyer has claimed that he's the victim of a conspiracy.

279.title: I wanted to kill Imran Khan because he was misleading people, confesses shooter in video
279.article_body: The suspect who shot at former Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad, confessed in a video, "I wanted to kill Imran Khan because he was misleading people." "I wanted to kill only Imran Khan and no one else...I came alone on my bike. There was no one else with me," he added.

280.title: Woman injured after portion of slab collapses at Mumbai's KEM Hospital
280.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was injured after a portion of a slab collapsed in the nurses hostel of KEM Hospital in Mumbai's Parel. Shiv Sena leader Anil Kokil said he'd raised the issue of the faulty slab but the administration didn't pay attention. The hospital administration, however, said major repair works will be undertaken in the next four to six weeks.

281.title: AirAsia India-Air India Express merger likely by 2023-end: Air India
281.article_body: Air India said an operational review process is underway to integrate budget carrier AirAsia India with Air India Express and the merger is likely by the end of 2023. Tata Group-owned Air India has also signed agreements to have a 100% stake in AirAsia India. Post-merger, the entity will be branded as Air India Express, according to a statement.

282.title: Delhi Metro's Airport Line to be affected till Nov-end for maintenance
282.article_body: Services on the Airport Express Line will be affected till the end of November due to track maintenance work, Delhi Metro said on Thursday. Regular announcements shall be made at stations and in trains accordingly to ensure that passengers are not inconvenienced, officials said. The 23-km line connects New Delhi and Delhi Sector-21 metro stations.

283.title: Man caught urinating on Delhi Metro track, says 'zyada ho gaya'
283.article_body: A Twitter user has shared a video in which a man can be seen urinating on the tracks of a Delhi Metro station. In the video, the man can be heard saying, "Ho gaya, zyada ho gaya (I [drank] a little too much)," on being asked, "Why are you urinating here?" The Twitter user tagged CMO Delhi in his tweet.

284.title: 26-year-old man dies after falling from building during a fight in Thane
284.article_body: A 26-year-old man died after falling from second floor of a building in Thane while fighting with another person, an official said. The victim, Sadique Ansari, and the other person entered into an argument over bringing water. During the fight, both fell from the building and sustained injuries. While Ansari died on the spot, the other person has been hospitalised.

285.title: Telangana BJP prez Bandi Sanjay detained enroute Munugode, released
285.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay was taken into preventive custody enroute to Munugode Assembly constituency where polling is underway today. He was staging a protest demanding that non-locals and TRS leaders should be sent out of the constituency since campaigning was over. After being shifted to Abdullapurmet Police Station, he was later released and taken to the state BJP office.

286.title: K'taka govt grants in-principle approval for Bengaluru Metro phase 3
286.article_body: The Karnataka government has granted in-principle approval for the Bengaluru Metro's phase 3, which comprises two lines. The first will run a length of 32.16 km from Kempapura to JP Nagar Fourth Phase and the second will run 12.82 km from Hosahalli to Kadabagere. The Kempapura-JP Nagar line will have 22 stations, while the Hosahalli-Kadabagere line will have nine stations.

287.title: Five Star Business Finance sets IPO band at 10.6% below unlisted price
287.article_body: Five Star Business Finance has fixed the IPO price band at ₹450-474 per share, about 10.6% below the current unlisted price. The ₹1,960 crore IPO, which is a pure offer for sale, opens for subscription on November 9 and closes on November 11. The company will offer shares to anchor investors on November 7 ahead of the IPO.

288.title: Raymond's Q2 net profit jumps over two-fold to ₹162 crore
288.article_body: Raymond reported over a two-fold jump in its consolidated net profit to ₹161.95 crore for the quarter ended September 30. Its revenue from operations increased by 39.76% to ₹2,168.24 crore from ₹1,551.32 crore in the corresponding quarter previous fiscal. Raymond’s total expenses surged 31.27% to ₹1,954.18 crore in the quarter against ₹1,488.64 crore a year back.

289.title: We'll continue to monitor ongoing developments: India after Imran Khan shot in the leg
289.article_body: Speaking about former Pakistan PM Imran Khan being shot in the leg in Wazirabad, India's Ministry of External Affairs said, "It's a development that just took place." "We're closely keeping an eye on [it] and we'll continue to monitor ongoing developments," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi. "[We] don't have anything beyond that to say as it's...a developing story," he added.

290.title: HDFC's net profit grows 17.8% in Q2 at ₹4,454.24 crore
290.article_body: HDFC reported a net profit of ₹4,454.24 crore in the July-September quarter, experiencing a year-on-year growth of 17.8% on the back of robust loan growth. The company's total interest income was ₹13,142.93 crore, increasing by 24.2% from a year ago period. HDFC's loan book grew 16% year-on-year on an asset under management basis.

291.title: Mumbai woman 'books' Dubai trip through fake website, loses ₹4 lakh
291.article_body: A 24-year-old woman from Mumbai's Andheri lost ₹4.08 lakh after booking a fake Dubai tour package through a fraudulent travel website in October, police said. The visas, tickets and hotel stay she had booked through the website also turned out to be fake. The woman had landed on the website while searching for travel websites on Google.

292.title: Pregnant woman denied admission at hospital over Aadhaar card in TN; dies
292.article_body: A 30-year-old woman pregnant with twins allegedly died after she was denied admission at a government hospital in Tamil Nadu's Tumakuru district. As per neighbours, the doctors at the district hospital refused to admit the woman in labour pain as she didn't have an Aadhaar or Maternity card. She delivered a baby at home and died while delivering the other.

293.title: 35-yr-old shoots neighbour for not involving him in event preparation in Delhi
293.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly shot his neighbour in Delhi for not involving him in the preparations of an event in their locality, police said on Thursday. The victim kept ignoring the accused, who wanted to take part in the preparations for the event. The victim sustained a gunshot injury on his back, said DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary.

294.title: Pic of suspected shooter who tried to assassinate ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan surfaces
294.article_body: Pakistani media has released the picture of the suspected shooter who allegedly tried to assassinate former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan during a rally near Wazirabad. Imran Khan was shot in the leg during the firing and was taken to a hospital in Lahore. Six other people are also said to have been injured in the attack.

295.title: Drugs main reason behind all crimes in Goa: MoS Shripad Naik
295.article_body: Union Minister of State for Tourism Shripad Naik on Thursday said that drug menace is the main reason behind all crimes in Goa. "I support Goa government and Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte in taking action against illegal activities in the tourism sector," Naik said. State government has been drafting various policies to ensure that no illegalities take place, he added.

296.title: Credit Suisse warns of potential profitability drop in Q4
296.article_body: Credit Suisse said the bank's profitability could be hit by a drop in asset management fees in the fourth quarter. Credit Suisse revealed that social media rumours that led to client asset outflows in first two weeks of October contributed to a decrease in assets under management. Last month, Credit Suisse reported a $4 billion loss in the third quarter.

297.title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan waves at his supporters after being shot in leg, video surfaces
297.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan waved at his supporters after being shot in the leg during his rally near Wazirabad. The official Twitter account of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) shared a video of the same and stated that he is in stable condition. He was taken to a hospital in Lahore by road following the attack.

298.title: Imran Khan issues statement after bullet injury, says 'Allah has given me another life'
298.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan, who was shot in his leg in firing during his rally in Pakistan's Wazirabad on Thursday, issued his first statement after the incident. "Allah has given me another life, I will fight back Inshallah," he reportedly said. "He is in a stable condition," Raoof Hasan, a senior aide, was quoted as saying.

299.title: PM should pull up Guj govt over 'sloppy' probe on Morbi tragedy: Kharge
299.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Thursday urged PM Narendra Modi to pull up the Gujarat government to come clean on the "sloppy investigation process" in the Morbi bridge collapse, which claimed over 130 lives. In a tweet, Kharge levelled a series of allegations. "Rusted cable of the bridge was not repaired...contractor was not qualified for the job," he wrote.

300.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad to merge all M&As into parent company ahead of IPO
300.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad filed a merger scheme to consolidate all its mergers and acquisitions in India into One upGrad, in preparation of its initial public offering (IPO) in 2024. The company said that it plans to complete the process by March-June 2023. In the last two-and-a-half years, upGrad has acquired 11 startups and overall acquired 14 companies across different verticals.

301.title: 16 child labourers, including 11 girls, rescued from Karnataka's Udupi
301.article_body: In an operation led by Karnataka's Udupi district administration, 16 minor child labourers, including 11 girls, were rescued from the Malpe port on Thursday, officials said. All the rescued children belong to Koppal and Davanagere districts. The children have been handed over to the Child Welfare Committee (CWC), where rehabilitation arrangements have been made for them, the officials added.

302.title: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan waves at his supporters after being shot in leg, video surfaces
302.article_body: Ex-Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan waved at his supporters after being shot in the leg during his rally in Wazirabad. The official Twitter account of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) shared a video, writing, "Imran Khan was shot in the leg but was stable while being taken to hospital. He waived at supporters too." Khan was taken to a hospital in Lahore.

303.title: Pakistan hand SA their 1st defeat in T20 World Cup 2022, stay alive in tournament
303.article_body: Pakistan on Thursday defeated South Africa by 33 runs (DLS method) in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Sydney. With this, South Africa suffered their first defeat in the tournament. Meanwhile, Pakistan jumped to the third position in the Group 2 with four points and stay alive in the tournament.

304.title: 'Dhairya rakhiye,' says Rajnath Singh as people in rally say 'we want PoK'
304.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday asked people to be patient after some of them in a rally in Himachal Pradesh asserted that they want Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). A video has surfaced online in which Singh can be seen smiling and saying, "Dhairya rakhiye," as people say, "PoK chahiye, PoK chaiye (We want PoK)."

305.title: 1 man loses hand, another injured while performing stunts on Mumbai train
305.article_body: Two persons sustained serious injuries while performing stunts on a local train in Mumbai on Monday. One of them lost their right hand while the other suffered head injuries after they fell off the train between Jogeshwari and Andheri railway stations. "We haven't registered any case yet as the men are admitted to a hospital...We'll book them [later]," police said.

306.title: 19-yr-old girl ends life after family beats her boyfriend to death in UP
306.article_body: A 19-year-old girl died by suicide after her family members beat her boyfriend to death in UP. According to the police, the incident took place in the Islampur locality of the Rampur Maniharan region. Local markets remained shut after the incident as the couple belonged to different faiths. A probe is on, said Saharanpur SSP Vipin Tada.

307.title: Over 20,000 schools shut down in India during 2020-21: Education Ministry
307.article_body: More than 20,000 schools were shut down across India during 2020-21, a report launched by the Ministry of Education on Thursday stated. "This decline may be attributed to postponement of admissions due to COVID-19," the report stated. Moreover, the number of teachers also declined by 1.95% in 2021-22 as compared to 2020-21, it added.

308.title: Mamaearth posts ₹19.8 cr net profit in FY22, revenue rises 102% YoY
308.article_body: Skincare and beauty startup Mamaearth posted a net profit of ₹19.8 crore on a standalone basis in the financial year 2021-22 as against a loss of ₹1,332 crore in the previous fiscal. The Gurugram-based firm's revenue grew 102% year-over-year to ₹952 crore in the fiscal, as per the filings with the Registrar of Companies (RoC).

309.title: BJP will win Gujarat elections with big margin: JP Nadda
309.article_body: BJP President JP Nadda on Thursday said his party will win the Gujarat Assembly elections with a big margin under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Nadda made the comments after the Election Commission of India (ECI) announced the schedule for the state election. The election will take place in two phases on December 1 and 5.

310.title: Will raise the issue in proper forum: Bangladesh on Virat Kohli's 'fake fielding'
310.article_body: Bangladesh Cricket Board's cricket operations chairman Jalal Yunus said they will raise the issue of Virat Kohli's alleged fake fielding against Bangladesh in a "proper forum". "We notified...umpire about fake throw but he said he didn't notice it and that's the reason he didn't take review. Shakib Al Hasan also discussed...it and even spoke with umpire after game," Jalal said.

311.title: SRK dances on Chaiyya Chaiyya, cuts b'day cake with fans; video surfaces
311.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan danced to the song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' from his film 'Dil Se' at the SRK Day event, which was organised on his birthday. He also cut his birthday cake with his fans. Several videos and pictures of the event have gone viral on social media platforms. The actor, who will feature in 'Pathaan', turned 57 on Wednesday.

312.title: DPRs to restore 150 lakes in B'luru Urban to be completed by Nov
312.article_body: The detailed project reports (DPR) to restore 150 lakes in Bengaluru Urban will be prepared by the end of this month, an official said. The list of lakes includes 72 lakes in Anekal, 38 in Yelahanka, 15 in Bangalore North, 13 in Bangalore East and 11 in Bangalore South. Already, the DPRs of 74 lakes have been completed.

313.title: Complaint against senior K’taka politicians in B’luru policeman’s death
313.article_body: A police complaint has been filed against senior politicians in Karnataka in the death of KR Puram Police Inspector HL Nandish in Bengaluru. In the complaint filed on November 2, social activist TJ Abraham blamed state ministers Araga Jnanendra, Byrathi Basavaraj and Bengaluru City Police chief CH Pratap Reddy for causing agony to Nandish, resulting in his fatal cardiac arrest.

314.title: Opp Congress launches state-wide protests against Kerala government
314.article_body: The Opposition Congress in Kerala launched state-wide protests against the Left government over their alleged administrative failure and anti-people policies like price-hike. Hundreds of party activists took out protest marches to the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram and to the respective Collectorates in other districts. The march to the Secretariat was led by KPCC chief K Sudhakaran.

315.title: Mangalore Airport to be renamed as 'Mangaluru' Airport: AAI
315.article_body: The Airport Authority of India has issued an official aeronautical information publication (AIP) supplement stating that the Mangalore Airport will be renamed Mangaluru Airport with effect from December 1. The AIP supplement stated that the intent is to officially inform all stakeholders regarding the name change in AIS (Aeronautical Information Services) products.

316.title: BJP distributing liquor, money to voters for Munugode by-polls: BRS
316.article_body: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) leader Dasoju Sravan has accused the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of illegally distributing hundreds of crores of liquor and money to voters for Munugode by-elections. He claimed BRS, earlier called TRS, has asked Telangana Chief Electoral Officer Vikas Raj to look into the matter. Notably, police recently seized liquor bottles from BRS leader Venkat Reddy's residence.

317.title: Not a big deal: Selena Gomez on her viral pic with Hailey Bieber
317.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez has reacted to her picture with Hailey Bieber, which went viral on social media platforms. "It's not a big deal. It's not even a thing," Selena said in a latest interview. Selena and Hailey, amid feud rumours, were seen posing together for the photographers at the 2022 Academy Museum Gala, which was held in October.

318.title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan shot in leg during his rally in Wazirabad: Reports
318.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan was shot in his leg in firing during his rally in Pakistan's Wazirabad on Thursday, as per reports. The firing was reported near the container of Imran Khan. He was transferred from the container to a bulletproof vehicle following the firing, as per reports. At least five other people have also been injured, reports added.

319.title: Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani scout wedding venues in Chandigarh: Report
319.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra and his rumoured girlfriend Kiara Advani are reportedly scouting wedding venues in Chandigarh. As per a source close to Sidharth, the duo contacted The Oberoi Sukhvilas Spa & Resorts, which is the same location where Rajkummar Rao and Patralekhaa tied the knot. The source added that the rumoured couple dropped the plans of getting married in Goa.

320.title: Rahul Gandhi performs tribal folk dance in Telangana, Cong shares video
320.article_body: During the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was seen performing a traditional folk dance, 'Dhimsa', in Telangana. Gandhi was joined by folk artists and state Congress chief Revanth Reddy during the dance. In another video, the Congress leader was seen whipping himself as part of a local tradition in Telangana.

321.title: Student throws money on dancing classmate, thrashed by teacher; video surfaces
321.article_body: A student was beaten up by a teacher after he threw currency notes on another student who was dancing at a school function in Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat. A video of the incident that took place in Alpine Public School has gone viral on social media. The video shows teacher thrashing the student with a stick.

322.title: 2 smuggle 2,112 liquor bottles hiding them between doors, held by Delhi Police
322.article_body: Two persons were arrested in Delhi on Thursday for attempting to smuggle 2,112 bottles of liquor into Bihar by hiding them inside wooden doors, police said. According to the police, the two smugglers were taking the bottles from Delhi to Bihar on a tempo by stacking them inside hollow doors. The bottles were cleverly concealed, a police official said.

323.title: SC dismisses plea to rename Bombay High Court to Maharashtra High Court
323.article_body: The Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed a plea to rename the Bombay High Court to Maharashtra High Court. The plea was filed by a former judge VP Patil who had served as a judge for 26 years. "These are issues for lawmakers to decide. What fundamental right is prejudiced for you to bring it here?" SC said.

324.title: KCR is PM Modi's copy in terms of attitude, thoughts: Rahul
324.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao is "a copy" of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in terms of attitude and thoughts. Furthermore, he said that Rao supported BJP in every bill in the Parliament. Currently, Rahul Gandhi is in Telangana for the Congress party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra.

325.title: Central Railway ticket checkers collect ₹1 cr fine each from violators
325.article_body: Central Railway's four ticket checkers in Mumbai Division collected around ₹1 crore each in the current financial year from 53,697 ticketless travellers, an official said. One of the train ticket inspectors caught 15,053 violators and collected ₹1.43 crore fine. Another caught 14,837 ticketless travellers and levied a fine of ₹1.34 crore. The two others collected around ₹1.03 crore fine each.

326.title: Example of BJP's misgovernance in Guj: Owaisi on Morbi bridge collapse
326.article_body: Following the Morbi bridge collapse incident in Gujarat, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday said what happened in Morbi is unfortunate and gives an example of BJP’s "misgovernance" in the state. Furthermore, he said, "Due to the misgovernance of BJP in Gujarat, many people lost lives during COVID-19. There is inflation and businesses have been affected."

327.title: Cannot go on any bridge now: Morbi bridge tragedy survivor
327.article_body: A survivor of the Morbi suspension bridge tragedy, in which over 135 people were killed, said that he gets scared every time he looks at the bridge. "I don't think I can go on any bridge now," the survivor said adding that the Morbi bridge was his favourite hangout spot, and he regularly visited it for several years.

328.title: Traffic disrupted as oil spilled on Sinhagad Road in Pune
328.article_body: Traffic was briefly disrupted after an unidentified vehicle reportedly spilled oil on Sinhagad Road between Pune's Panmala and Rajaram Bridge on Thursday morning. A fire brigade team rushed to the spot and threw sand and dust on the road to prevent accidents. Fire brigade officials claimed that they were unaware of how oil had spilled onto the road.

329.title: GIC, ESR establish $600 mn JV in India for industrial, logistics assets
329.article_body: GIC and ESR Group have set up a joint venture (JV) worth $600 million to buy profit-making industrial and logistics assets in India. The companies said the JV will invest in "stabilised operational assets" in tier 1 and tier 2 cities of the country. The JV is an extension of an existing partnership between the entities in the country.

330.title: When we got engaged, people said he's marrying an aunty: Kapil Dev's wife
330.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Kapil Dev's wife Romi Dev told Sonakshi Sinha and Huma Qureshi that they've lived her life in their film 'Double XL'. Talking about the film and its subject, Romi recalled being body-shamed and how when she got engaged to Kapil Dev, people said he was marrying an aunty. She said she "loved every minute" of the film.

331.title: Indian bowlers got smashed vs Bangladesh, this is a wake-up call: Raina
331.article_body: Ex-India batter Suresh Raina said the Indian bowling attack got "smashed around" during their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh, adding that it was a "learning curve" for them. "We might have won but even Rohit Sharma admitted...that Bangladesh were better than India. This is a wake-up call," added Raina. "The match was in Bangladesh's favour," he stated.

332.title: Shinde govt formed to serve Guj instead of Maha: NCP's Jayant Patil
332.article_body: NCP leader Jayant Patil on Thursday criticised the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government over the loss of big industrial projects and accused it of "serving Gujarat". "Projects are being shifted to Gujarat and the CM and Deputy CM are mute spectators," Patil said. "Conspiracy was hatched to bring a new government...so that the...government would serve Gujarat more than Maharashtra," he added.

333.title: Mumbai man cheated of ₹50 lakh by HK woman posing as crypto analyst
333.article_body: A Mumbai man has filed a police complaint after being allegedly defrauded of ₹50.40 lakh by a Hong Kong-based woman. The woman, who allegedly posed as a cryptocurrency analyst at JP Morgan, Hong Kong, befriended the man on WhatsApp earlier this year. The woman persuaded him to invest in a crypto coin of the People's Bank of China.

334.title: Boeing could generate $100 bn in revenue annually by 2025: CEO
334.article_body: Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun said the US planemaker could generate $100 billion in revenue annually by 2025. Boeing last recorded $100 billion in revenue in 2018. In its first public investor meeting since 2016, Boeing said it expects to deliver 800 commercial jets at least by 2025, pegging the MAX and 787 production per month at 50 and 10, respectively.

335.title: Archean Chemical Industries sets price band for IPO at ₹386-407
335.article_body: Archean Chemical Industries, a speciality marine chemical manufacturer, said it has fixed a price band of ₹386-407 a share for its ₹1,462-crore initial public offering. The offer is going to be opened for subscription on November 9 and the closing date will be November 11. The bidding for anchor investors will open on November 7, according to the company.

336.title: Mere possession of jihadi literature is not an offence: Delhi court to NIA
336.article_body: While dealing with an Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA) case, a Delhi court said it was unfathomable that "mere possession of jihadi literature" or philosophy "would amount to an offence". NIA has accused 11 people of aligning themselves with the terrorist organisation Islamic State of Iraq and Syria and "being part of various ISIS propaganda channels" on social media applications.

337.title: Rajeev proposes lie detector test after Charu's cheating allegations
337.article_body: After Charu Asopa accused her husband Rajeev Sen of cheating on her, the latter said that couples should take a lie detector test, especially when they don't have proof for their respective allegations. In a new interview, Charu responded to Rajeev's statement and said she is "ready" to take a lie detector test, adding that she's "only spoken the truth".

338.title: Magical, took a lot of presence of mind: Gavaskar on Rahul's run out
338.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Bangladesh opener Litton Das' run out following a direct hit by KL Rahul during the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Bangladesh was a "magical moment". "[It] took a lot of presence of mind...He had to change his shape while throwing," added Gavaskar. "The run out...turned the game on its head," he stated.

339.title: When India says something on global forum, others listen carefully: Rajnath Singh
339.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday said that today when India says anything on the global forum, other countries listen carefully. Singh was addressing a political rally in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh. "No one can deny the fact that after PM Modi became Prime Minister, India's prestige increased on the global stage," Singh added.

340.title: No new commitments made to Russia beyond terms of grain deal: Ukraine
340.article_body: Ukraine has said it made no new commitments to Russia beyond the terms agreed under the Black Sea Grains Initiative to persuade Moscow to resume its participation in the deal. The clarification comes after the Russian Defence Ministry said that it received guarantees from Ukraine that it would not use the Black Sea grain corridor for military purposes against Russia.

341.title: 1-yr-old girl kidnapped in Mumbai rescued from Solapur, 2 women arrested
341.article_body: A one-year-old girl, who was kidnapped from Mumbai's Santacruz area four days ago, was rescued and two women were arrested, police said on Thursday. The women were allegedly trying to sell the toddler in Telangana. The toddler was rescued from Solapur railway station by the Mumbai Police Crime Branch with the help of RPF, Mumbai Police Commissioner Vivek Phansalkar said.

342.title: Unconscious patient lies on floor in UP hospital while dog licks blood, video surfaces
342.article_body: A video, that surfaced online, showed a man covered in blood and lying unconscious on the floor of an emergency ward of a government hospital in Uttar Pradesh while a street dog roamed around him licking blood. Later, Chief Medical Superintendent Satendra Kumar Verma said that action was taken against four officials and the man was referred to another hospital.

343.title: Sack the medical panel: Kamran after Fakhar gets ruled out of T20 WC
343.article_body: Talking about Pakistan batter Fakhar Zaman being ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022, Pakistani wicketkeeper Kamran Akmal said, "The medical panel, selectors, captain and coach are answerable. The medical panel should be sacked." "PCB has kept this medical panel on what basis? They don't know about injuries...The ones fit and scoring runs in domestic cricket...face...criticism," added Kamran.

344.title: Coinbase Chief Product Officer Surojit Chatterjee resigns
344.article_body: US-based cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase's Chief Product Officer Surojit Chatterjee has resigned from his position, the company filing said. The decision was "mutually agreed" upon and Chatterjee will serve the company in an advisory role until February 2023, Coinbase said. Earlier this year, Coinbase had cut its team size by 18%, a decision that CEO Brian Armstrong attributed to recession.

345.title: Govt not serious about ‘monstrous’ problem: Varun Gandhi on Delhi’s air quality
345.article_body: With air quality deteriorating in Delhi, BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Thursday said neither the government nor the public are serious about resolving this "monstrous" problem. "Eight out of 10 children in Delhi-NCR have respiratory problems. After years of discussions, why is there a continuing lack of concern and coordination between multiple government entities?" he added.

346.title: Video shows 3-storey building collapsing in Ghaziabad due to digging work
346.article_body: A 3-storeyed building collapsed in Ghaziabad on Wednesday afternoon after developing cracks because of digging work done on a nearby plot by a builder. A video of the incident shows people screaming while the building collapses. One of the residents claimed that the builder hadn't informed anyone about the digging work.

347.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra stopped religious polarisation in T'gana: Cong MP
347.article_body: AICC Minority Department Chairman and Congress Rajya Sabha MP Imran Pratapgarhi said that the Bharat Jodo Yatra stopped religious polarisation in Telangana. He added that its success in Hyderabad shows people's vigilance about polarisation the BJP and TRS have created.
