"Rahul Gandhi's speech has removed the secular mask that K Chandrashekar Rao has been wearing since 2014," Pratapgarhi stated.

348.title: Ratan Tata-backed CashKaro.com raises ₹130 cr in Series C funding round
348.article_body: CashKaro.com, a cashback and coupons platform, has secured ₹130 crore in a Series C funding round led by Affle Global Pte Ltd. After the latest round, the company's total funds are over ₹225 crore from investors including Ratan Tata, Kalaari Capital, Korea Investment Partners and others. The company was founded by Swati Bhargava and Rohan Bhargava in April 2013.

349.title: Maharashtra government to develop 180-km Pune-Nashik expressway
349.article_body: Maharashtra government will develop a 180-km long expressway between Pune and Nashik to provide faster connectivity between Mumbai, Pune and Nashik, officials said. "There'll be flight landing and takeoff facilities on the expressway and emergency telephones at every five km," an MSRDC official said. It'll also have rest area at every 50 km and IT services including free wi-fi access.

350.title: Ishaan Khatter & me will always root for each other: Janhvi Kapoor
350.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up about her upcoming film 'Mili' and Ishaan Khatter's 'Phone Bhoot' releasing on the same day. Janhvi said, "Ishaan messaged me...wishing me luck for 'Mili'...I wished him back saying, 'Right back at you!'." "We really wish the best for each other from the heart...A part of us will always root for each other," she stated.

351.title: Turkish Prez says he could discuss $8 charge for verified badge with Elon Musk
351.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan has said he may negotiate the monthly $8 charge for "verified" badge with Twitter's new boss Elon Musk. During an interview, Erdoğan said, "It might be different for us...We could carry out some diplomacy with him as well." After $44 billion Twitter buyout, Musk said the platform will charge $8 a month for "verified" badge.

352.title: 30 foreign nationals deported for overstaying in Delhi's Dwarka
352.article_body: As many as 30 foreign nationals were deported from the Dwarka area in Delhi, officials said on Thursday. Of the 30, 27 were Nigerian nationals, two were from Ivory Coast and one was Ivoirienne national. "They were found overstaying in India without a valid visa. They were produced before the FRRO who ordered their deportation," an official statement read.

353.title: Arrest me if I committed a crime that big: Soren on his ED summon
353.article_body: A day after being summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren asked the central probe agency to just arrest him if he had committed a crime that big. "I've been summoned by the ED today when I already have a programme in Chhattisgarh...Security near ED office has increased. Why are you scared of Jharkhandis?" he added.

354.title: Dubai's Burj Khalifa lights up for Shah Rukh's b'day, actor reacts
354.article_body: Dubai's Burj Khalifa was lit up with Shah Rukh Khan's name to celebrate his 57th birthday. Reacting to the video shared by Mohamed Ali Alabbar, developer of Burj Khalifa, Shah Rukh thanked the team for "putting me on top of the world every year". The building also displayed a 'Happy birthday Pathaan' and 'We love you' message for the actor.

355.title: Show KL Rahul's run out to those who don't believe in luck: Uthappa
355.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa termed KL Rahul's direct hit that resulted in Bangladesh opener Litton Das being run out during the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Bangladesh as "incredible". "That runout upended the match and gave India...momentum when they had none," said Uthappa. "Those who don't believe in luck, show them...[the run out]," added Uthappa.

356.title: Meta tests feature to let creators make, sell NFTs on Instagram
356.article_body: Meta on Wednesday announced that it's testing a feature that will allow creators to make and sell non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on Instagram. It is also testing a feature through which viewers of Reels will be able to send virtual gifts to their favourite creators. Additionally, Meta said it's giving all eligible US creators access to Instagram Subscriptions.

357.title: Black belt Rahul Gandhi corrects child's karate techniques, video surfaces
357.article_body: Congress has shared a video from Rahul Gandhi's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in which he can be seen interacting with a karate kid. In the video, Gandhi, who's a black belt in Aikido, was seen supervising the deliveries of the kid and correcting his techniques. "If the technique is wrong, the country goes on to the path of destruction," Congress tweeted.

358.title: Russia summons British envoy over drone strike on its fleet in Crimea
358.article_body: Russia has summoned the British ambassador over Moscow's allegations that British navy personnel were involved in a drone attack on Russia's Black Sea Fleet in Crimea, which it blames on Ukraine. Ambassador Deborah Bronnert arrived at Russian Foreign Ministry and was inside for about 30 minutes. After the drone attack, Russia temporarily suspended participation in the Turkey-brokered grain deal.

359.title: Man kills alcoholic son with axe on granddaughter's birthday in Pune
359.article_body: A 55-year-old man allegedly killed his alcoholic son when the family was celebrating his granddaughter's birthday in Pune district's Pimpri-Chinchwad on Tuesday. Balu Baban Borkar, a labourer, allegedly killed Sameer with an axe when the latter came home in a drunken state. "Balu was…disappointed with his son's bad habits and fed up of spoiling [the]…birthday celebrations," a police official said.

360.title: BSc degree holder runs fake path lab in Gurugram, screens 700+ people; held
360.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar's Flying Squad and the state health department have jointly busted a fake pathology lab in Gurugram and seized 45 rapid test kits and other items. They have also arrested a man who had been running the fake lab for one year and screened over 750 people during this period. He only has a BSc degree.

361.title: WB CM Mamata seeks waiver of 20% customs duty on Gobindobhog rice, writes to PM
361.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday wrote a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking an exemption of 20% customs duty on state's famed Gobindobhog rice. In the letter, Banerjee said that the duty on Gobindobhog should be exempted in a similar manner as Basmati rice. She added that the Centre's decision has negatively impacted Gobindobhog's export.

362.title: Close Delhi schools till air quality improves: NCPCR to Delhi govt
362.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) chairperson Priyank Kanoongo has asked the Delhi government to shut schools in the city until the air quality improves. "Air pollution of 'severe level' affects healthy people and seriously impacts children and those with existing diseases, according to CPCB," said Kanoongo in his letter.

363.title: K'taka govt instructs schools & PU colleges to introduce 10-min meditation session
363.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has directed the schools and pre-university colleges across the state to introduce a 10-minute 'dhyana' (meditation) session for students every day. Meditation would help students in increasing concentration, Nagesh tweeted while sharing the official order. "This will help students develop a positive attitude...and become good citizens," the order read.

364.title: NCB's Mumbai unit to get 2 highly-trained dogs to sniff out drug couriers
364.article_body: The Mumbai unit of Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) will soon have two highly-trained sniffer dogs to sniff out drug couriers. NCB was earlier reliant on sniffer dogs of customs department used at the airport and sniffer dogs of the Mumbai Police. "To be effective, they need to be specifically trained...which will be the case with...two sniffer dogs," an official said.

365.title: Pakistan's Iftikhar Ahmed smashes biggest six in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022
365.article_body: Pakistan's Iftikhar Ahmed on Thursday smashed the biggest six in Super 12 stage of T20 World Cup 2022. The 32-year-old smashed a 106-metre six on the bowling of South Africa pacer Lungi Ngidi in Pakistan's 16th over to achieve the feat. The previous biggest six (104 metres) in the Super 12 stage was slammed by David Miller against India.

366.title: GHMC to beautify Hyderabad flyovers with paintings, vertical gardens
366.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is set to beautify flyovers with paintings and vertical gardens on pillars. "Extended Chandrayangutta flyover...and the under-construction Kothaguda flyover along with other Strategic Road Development Plan (SRDP) projects will have vertical gardens," a GHMC official said. Authorities will also install benches to utilise space under the flyovers.

367.title: Rajasthan BJP MP slaps government employee in public; video surfaces
367.article_body: BJP MP from Rajasthan's Chittorgarh, Chandra Prakash Joshi, slapped a government employee in public for allegedly demanding a bribe. A video of the incident, which happened at the Narcotics office in Pratapgarh, surfaced online. Joshi slapped the employee after farmers purportedly complained he had taken a bribe of ₹5,000 from them in the name of opium conversion and licence distribution.

368.title: Fire breaks out at godown in Pune's Sopan Nagar, no casualty reported
368.article_body: Fire broke out at a godown on Ahmednagar road in Pune's Sopan Nagar on Thursday. According to the Pune Fire Brigade, five fire tenders were rushed to the spot. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far and efforts to douse the blaze are currently going on. Further details about damages are awaited.

369.title: No time to pass order on Salman's plea in defamation case against neighbour: HC judge
369.article_body: Bombay High Court's Justice Chandrakant Bhadang said he wouldn't be able to pass an order on Salman Khan's plea in a defamation case against his neighbour due to lack of time before his retirement. He added that the appeal would be placed before another judge after the Diwali vacation. Salman had accused his neighbour of posting his derogatory videos online.

370.title: Sushmita always told me to prioritise my own happiness: Charu Asopa
370.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa said that Sushmita Sen never asked her to try and resolve the differences between her and her estranged husband Rajeev Sen. "She has never told us to work it out. She has always told me to prioritise my own happiness, from day one," Asopa said. Recently, Charu had accused Rajeev of physical violence and infidelity.

371.title: Porn addicted 16-yr-old rapes 15-yr-old girl in K'taka; strangles her
371.article_body: A 16-year-old has been arrested for raping and strangling a 15-year-old girl to death in Karnataka, police said on Thursday. The accused was addicted to porn and watched porn videos most of the time, police said. The incident took place on Tuesday when the deceased had gone to attend nature's call. The accused assaulted the girl in a sugarcane field.

372.title: India's services sector PMI rises to 55.1 in Oct after 6-month low in Sept
372.article_body: India's services sector activity surged to 55.1 in October from September's six-month low of 54.3, the S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) showed. The services PMI was above the neutral 50-mark for the 15th month in a row. According to the survey data, demand from the local Indian market was the key driver for services firms in October.

373.title: 48 including local BJP leader held guilty for 2002 riots in MP's Satna
373.article_body: A court sentenced 48 persons, including a local BJP leader, to seven years of imprisonment in the 2002 riots case in Madhya Pradesh's Satna. It held the accused guilty of rioting, voluntarily causing hurt to a public servant and other charges. The case pertains to an attack on the then SP, collector and others after a tribal died by suicide.

374.title: 3-year-old girl playing on a slide at Mumbai mall falls, dies
374.article_body: A three-and-a-half-year-old girl died after allegedly sustaining injuries while playing in the kids' zone of a shopping mall in Mumbai's Ghatkopar on Sunday. According to the police, Dalisha Verma sustained injuries on her head after she fell off while sliding down a slide at Neelyog Mall. An official said a CCTV footage showed there was no negligence or foul play.

375.title: Man climbs tree on not getting stall in Delhi, falls as branches break down
375.article_body: A 52-year-old Nepali national on Wednesday climbed a tree in Delhi's Sarojini Nagar market, complaining that he did not get a stall in the market despite repeated requests. However, the tree branches broke down suddenly and he fell on the net held by police and fire brigade staff. He is now being treated at the AIIMS Trauma centre.

376.title: 'Rahul ko hai bachana': BJP to Cong over '3 monkeys' reaction on Guj poll
376.article_body: Before the EC shared the official dates for the Gujarat polls on Thursday, Congress reacted with emoticons of 'three monkeys', who see no evil, hear no evil and speak no evil. Responding to Congress' tweet, BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla said, "ECI par nishana kyunki Rahul ko hai bachana." Gujarat polls will be held in two phases on December 1 and 5.

377.title: Institutions acting against corrupt need not be defensive: PM Modi
377.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said institutions acting against the corrupt and corruption need not be defensive while doing their work. PM Modi was addressing a programme marking Vigilance Awareness Week of the Central Vigilance Commission. "We have been trying to change the system made by ‘abhaav’ (lack) and ‘dabaav’ (pressure) in the last eight years," PM Modi added.

378.title: Ukraine urges citizens to not post details of missing Ukrainians on social media
378.article_body: Ukrainian government has urged citizens not to post information regarding missing soldiers and civilians on social media as it could help Russia identify valuable prisoners and track down people trying to avoid being captured. Ukraine's Deputy Defence Minister said publishing details of prisoners' personal lives, political views or social status could complicate process of securing their release.

379.title: Bikaji Foods raises ₹262 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
379.article_body: Bikaji Foods International has mobilised ₹262.11 crore from 36 anchor investors ahead of its initial public offering. The firm has allocated 87.37 lakh equity shares to anchor investors at ₹300 per share, aggregating the transaction size to ₹262.11 crore. The company said 36.83 lakh shares or 42.16% of anchor book were allocated to 10 domestic mutual funds through 17 schemes.

380.title: Journalist asks Shakib 'Were you discussing Bangladeshi rivers with umpire?'; video viral
380.article_body: During the press conference after India-Bangladesh match, a journalist asked Shakib Al Hasan, "Were you discussing Bangladeshi rivers with the umpire?" The journalist asked this after questioning Shakib for not convincing umpire to not play after the rain. A video of the same went viral. Shakib explained to him that the discussion with the umpire was regarding the revised target.

381.title: Mumbai Traffic Police share post on seat belt safety with 'Pathaan' reference
381.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police took to Twitter on Wednesday and shared a clip from the teaser of Shah Rukh Khan's 'Pathaan' to spread awareness about seat belt safety. In the clip, Shah Rukh can be heard saying, "Put on your seat belt." Along with the clip, Mumbai Traffic Police tweeted, "'Jab tak hai jaan', listen to this sound advice."

382.title: Foreign currency worth ₹4 cr seized from Dubai-bound passengers' saree, shoes in Mumbai
382.article_body: Customs at Mumbai's International Airport seized foreign currency worth more than ₹4 crore concealed in saree and shoes in luggage of a family of three Indian passengers departing to Dubai. The family had two elderly passengers and one other male passenger. The three passengers have been arrested and have been sent to judicial custody.

383.title: Bouncers assault forest official, his friends outside Gurugram club
383.article_body: Forest department employee, Dev Kumar, has alleged that bouncers assaulted him and his friends at a club in Gurugram, police said. Kumar alleged that bouncers attacked him and his friends while waiting for a friend, who had gone inside the club to retrieve his phone. Assault was stopped when the manager of another club intervened, Kumar added.

384.title: B'luru man chops off 21-yr-old's hand as he objects to throwing tissue
384.article_body: A man allegedly chopped off a 21-year-old youth's left hand and right thumb in Bengaluru after he objected to him and his friends over throwing tissue paper on his table. Police have booked the man and his friends. Meanwhile, the victim's severed hand and thumb were reported missing from the crime scene and police suspect dogs might have eaten them.

385.title: 4 of a family from Hyderabad killed after bus hits car in Andole
385.article_body: A family of four people, including a one-year-old infant, died in a road accident at Kamsanpalle in Andole. The family hailed from Quthubullapur in Hyderabad. The incident reportedly occurred after a bus driver had hit their Maruti 800 car due to low visibility in morning, killing all four persons on the spot. The bodies were shifted to a government hospital.

386.title: Mohanlal's 'Barroz' not based on my script anymore: Writer Jijo Punnoose
386.article_body: Writer Jijo Punnoose revealed that 'Barroz' isn't based on his script anymore. He said that Mohanlal has "fashioned the screenplay and the character of Barroz...to satisfy his fan base". The writer added that since his script is no longer being used for the Mohanlal film, he and his team would make the film in English/Hispanic as per their initial plans.

387.title: Congress in self-destruction mode, has no future: Kuldeep Bishnoi
387.article_body: BJP leader Kuldeep Bishnoi on Thursday said Congress is in "self-destruction mode" and has no future. The former Congress leader, Bishnoi, added that Rahul Gandhi is conducting the "padyatra" to save his own reputation. "If Rahul Gandhi wants to do political suicide, he can. I cannot do that by being in Congress," Bishnoi stated.

388.title: Tiger Global, Sequoia-backed unicorn Chargebee fires 100 employees
388.article_body: Tiger Global and Sequoia-backed revenue management startup Chargebee has laid off around 100 employees, citing adverse macroeconomic factors. "This difficult decision was driven by...our need to address the operational debt...accumulated in last few years," CEO Krish Subramanian said. The layoffs come nine months after the unicorn raised $250 million which doubled its valuation to $3.5 billion.

389.title: Gokhale bridge in Mumbai's Andheri to be shut for 2 years
389.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to shut down the Gokhale bridge to all vehicular traffic for a minimum of two years. The bridge, a part of which collapsed in 2018, killing two, is a key connector between Andheri east and west. The BMC has also written to the traffic police to draw up alternative routes for commuters.

390.title: Ex-Miss Barbados claims Miss World 2000 was 'rigged' to favour Priyanka, posts video
390.article_body: A YouTuber and former Miss Barbados 2000 alleged that the Miss World pageant of 2000, which Priyanka Chopra won, was "rigged". Leilani McConney said the show was sponsored by ZeeTV, an Indian cable station, and alleged that Priyanka was 'favoured'. Leilani claimed in her video that Priyanka's gowns were better made and she was even allowed food in her room.

391.title: Who are the ICC Player of the Month nominees for October as 3 Indians included?
391.article_body: The ICC on Thursday announced the Player of the Month nominees for the month of October. South Africa's David Miller, India's Virat Kohli and Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza have been nominated for ICC Men's Player of the Month award, while India's Jemimah Rodrigues and Deepti Sharma, and Pakistan's Nida Dar have been nominated for the women's category.

392.title: Virat Kohli gets nominated for ICC Player of the Month award for the first time ever
392.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has been nominated for the ICC Men's Player of the Month award for the first time since the award's inception. Kohli amassed 205 T20I runs in October at an average of 205 and a strike-rate of 150.73. So far, four Indians have bagged the ICC Men's Player of the Month award.

393.title: WhatsApp announces new features including in-chat polls, groups with up to 1024 users
393.article_body: Meta-owned messaging platform WhatsApp on Thursday announced several new features. The platform will roll out features including Communities on WhatsApp, in-chat polls, 32-person video calling, groups with up to 1024 users. WhatsApp said, "Just like emoji reactions, larger file sharing, and admin delete, these features can be used in any group but will be particularly helpful for Communities."

394.title: Ex-Navy chief Admiral Ramdas joins Rahul for Bharat Jodo Yatra in T’gana
394.article_body: Former Navy chief Admiral L Ramdas joined Congress leader Rahul Gandhi during the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Telangana on Thursday. "Admiral Ramdas…who at 89 continues to be an indefatigable campaigner for public causes, along with his wife Lalita Ramdas…walked with Rahul Gandhi on day 57 of Bharat Jodo Yatra," Congress’ Jairam Ramesh tweeted.

395.title: 9-yr-old Bengaluru boy wins World Youth Scrabble Tournament
395.article_body: A nine-year-old Bengaluru boy, Samarth Manchali, has been declared the best under-10 player in World Youth Scrabble Championship-2022. Samarth is a resident of Vidyaranyapura and student of MES Kishora Kendra school. Two other players from India also made it into the top 10 players list of the global virtual tournament, the Scrabble Association of India announced.

396.title: FM Sitharaman calls 'Kantara' a well-made film, praises Rishab Shetty
396.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman called 'Kantara' a "well-made" film, which "captures the rich traditions of Tuluvanadu and Karavali". Sitharaman, who watched the Kannada film in Bengaluru on Wednesday, also praised the film's director-writer Rishab Shetty. Recently, politician Piyush Goyal also spoke about the Kannada film and how it has "grossed nearly 20 times its investment".

397.title: Babar isn't capable of being the anchor, aggressor like Kohli: Gambhir
397.article_body: Gautam Gambhir has said Virat Kohli is one of the "very few" players who has the ability to play the role of an anchor as well as an aggressor. "Kane Williamson, Steve Smith, Joe Root and Babar Azam don't have that ability," added Gambhir. Kohli was named Player of the Match in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh.

398.title: 4 booked, 1 arrested for trying to extort ₹65 lakh from builder in Pune
398.article_body: Pune City Police booked four persons and arrested another for allegedly trying to extort ₹65 lakh from a builder. "One of the accused has been arrested and search is on for others," police said. The builder had taken a loan of ₹1.85 crore from the accused and returned ₹2.3 crore but they were still demanding ₹65 lakh more, police added.

399.title: Ex-housekeeper sues Bezos over racial bias, 'unsanitary' working conditions at his home
399.article_body: Jeff Bezos has been sued by a former housekeeper who alleged that she was subjected to racial discrimination by his staff and forced to work long hours in unsanitary conditions at his Seattle home. According to Mercedes Wedaa's complaint, she sometimes worked 10-14 hours per day and the staff didn't have a designated break room or an easily accessible restroom.

400.title: 'Pathaan' is a cool action film like 'Mission Impossible': SRK
400.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan said that his upcoming film 'Pathaan' is a "cool action film" like 'Mission Impossible'. "I've always wanted to do something like 'Mission Impossible', cool action film. I think 'Pathaan' is like that," he said. The actor added that 'Pathaan' and his other upcoming releases, 'Dunki' and 'Jawan', are films that he's never attempted before.
